Among the businesses represented are the sale of bread, food, beer, and clothing, as well as services such as welding, public transportation, and education. There is always competition in the commercial arena and the situation that the members face is no exception. Many of them must do much more work than their peers in order to generate a reasonable income to meet their obligations and support their families.

This loan will be used to purchase supplies, materials, and tools to help them increase their sales, improve their incomes, and give their families a better quality of life. Among their expectations are to improve their sales with better merchandise, proviD. their children with a college education, and acquire a permanent home since most of the members do not own a house. In general, the members are familiar with loan products and know how to work as part of a solidarity group because of their experience with other institutions that offer this service. They are satisfied with the service provided by the Foundation and are grateful for the financial support and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 48-year-old married man with 5 children, 2 of whom are still unemployed. In 2005, he started working as a taxi driver, servicing his town and its surroundings. He also arranges private transportation upon client request in order to make extra money. Today, Mostafa is requesting a $1,200 loan to renew his car with needed maintenance and painting in order to activate his business and present a good quality of service to his clients to earn income.

loans.use: maintenance and painting for his vehicle

loans.name: Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Es centro focal de German Busch, que se encuentra en la zona de Huayna Potosí – ciudad de El Alto, tiene entre sus asociaciones comunales, la asociación comunal de “Palmeras”.

La asociación comunal de Palmeras se encuentra en el ciclo Nº2, está compuesto por 8 mujeres y 1 varón.  Su horario de reunión es 10:30 de la mañana los días viernes.  Cuando se conversa sobre las actividades de las socias, ellas refieren que son diferentes: venta de colchas, frutas, comida, helados, discos compactos (DVD´s), costura de buzos y turismo.
Paola Andrea T. F. es una socia jóven de 20 años de edad, ya está casada, tiene un pequeño hijo de un año de edad.  Su negocio desde hace un año es vender DVD´s de manera ambulante, en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.   Comenzo de a poco, no hubo un mentor.  Ahora está solicitando Bs.800.- y con esto espera comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
The German Busch Community Center can be found in the District of Huayna Potosí in the City of El Alto. Among the groups that meets at the Center is the Communal Association “Palmeras” (Palms).

The Palmeras Communal Association is starting its second loan cycle with nine members, eight women and one man. They meet at 10:30am every Friday. When talking about the businesses of the members, they consist of a variety of different activities: quilt sales, fruit sales, preparing food, ice cream sales, DVD sales, sewing sweatshirts, and tourism.

One of the younger members is Paola Andrea T. F.. She is 20 years old, married, and has a one year old child. For the past year, she has been selling DVDs as a traveling vendor through the different fairs in the City of El Alto. She started with very little and did not have anyone to mentor her. Paola is now requesting a loan of 800 BOB with which she plans to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Mrs. Auntouch Koy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people who live in Boeng Khpob village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Auntouch K. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan to buy something that can expand their businesses. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Chhorn, is a fisherman. They have some problems because their farm is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Auntouch K. decided ask for a loan to buy a water machine and taro root to grow. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and taro root

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a citizen of a city named Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is 40-year-old woman. Many years ago, she started a business making artificial flowers. She successfully obtained good customers with her struggle. Now this work gives her good income, which she uses to pay for utilities. 

Her husband's name is J. and he is involved in the timber-selling business. He has been in this profession for over five years. Naseem is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand her husband’s timber-selling business.

loans.use: To buy timber in bulk

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es: Guadalupe de Jesús O. M. de 35 años de edad,  reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada y junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Guadalupe posee una venta de productos varios como cosméticos, granos básicos detergente, cremas para cabello y cuerpo y otros más. El negocio esta ubicado sobre la calle principal que lleva a Lourdes Colón, por lo que cuenta con muy buena visibilidad por parte de las personas lo cual le permite contar con muchos clientes. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de frijoles, arroz, harina, y más cosméticos, los cuales están entre los productos que más se venden. Guadalupe, posee el deseo de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y de esta manera salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe de Jesús O. M. is 35 years old and resides in Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is an employee for a private company, and together they have an 11 year old son who is a student. Guadalupe has a store where she sells various products such as cosmetics, basic grains, detergents, hair and body crèmes, and other items. Her business is located on the main road leading to Lourdes Colón, so it has good visibility and attracts many customers.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy beans, rice, flour, and more cosmetics since these are the products that she sells the most. She desires to improve her financial stability so that her family can move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & dry goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine V. is a religious woman and a hard-working entrepreneur who has been in business for more than 20 years. She is a married mother of three children. Her husband is a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver in the community while she manages her own variety store to supply additional income for the family.  
 
Josephine would like to receive a loan as working capital to buy additional groceries for her variety store. A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2005, Josephine has been a dedicated member regularly attending weekly center meetings and making solid repayments on previous loans.

Her long-term goals include having a full-fledged mini-groceries store. Also, she hopes that the profits from her business will fund her three children's continued education until they have completed college degrees.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Josephine is determined to achieve a winning business to build more long-term financial security for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with a 9-year-old son, Yevgenyi. She runs a small retail item sale venture in a town of Vasilyevka. Victoria sells toys, souvenirs and children's clothing in one of the local stores in her hometown. This department store is a popular stop for many local shoppers. Victoria has been in this business for only one year. However, her gross income is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Victoria is requesting a loan of 3,600 Grivnyas to increase her working capital, boost her sales and get additional revenue. She is very energetic and goal-oriented, which is the best motivation in her work. We believe this entrepreneur has much potential and will work just as hard to see her business flourish and expand even more.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice P. makes a living by selling maize flour and onions at a local market, and is applying for a loan to buy additional items, such as tomatoes and dried fish, to sell. Alice is 30 years old and married to a teacher. She has two children, one of whom goes to school.  With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables such as okra, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  Mary is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Pesantez es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la misma que se caracteriza por sus paisajes, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a la ciudad y también a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica  a la cría de ganado, cuyes, pollos los que vende en su propia parroquia, también trabaja en la agricultura labrando sus tierras.

La Señora Carmen tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 18, 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad y su última hija se encuentra en una escuela, su esposo es chofer de un taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero de manera independiente.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y fue invitada por una gran amiga del bankito, el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de unas vaquitas, su meta es llegar a tener  un asadero de pollos como negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen Pesantez is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) Communal Bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish, which is known for its landscapes. The people devote themselves to farming and livestock. Much of the population has migrated to the city and to various places in the world looking for a better quality of life for their families. Our member raises cattle, guinea pigs, and chickens. She sells them in her own parish. She also works in agriculture; she works her land. Carmen is 37, married, and has four children. The children are 18, 17, 14, and 11 years old. Her first three children go to a high school in the area, and her last daughter is in elementary school. Her husband is a taxi drive. She does not have her own house. She lives in her parents’ house, but in an independent manner. Three years ago our member was invited to become part of the communal bank by a great friend from the communal bank. She will use the new loan to buy some calves. Her goal is to come to have a chicken roasting business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. José Andrés R. es padre  de familia  de un niño de siete años  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena y zinc para su casa de habitación y gastos de medicamentos para uno de sus hijos.
Don José R. dice  que toda la plata  que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y ha mejorando su hogar de acuerdo a sus posibilidades de sus ingresos y los prestamos brindados.
texts.en:
José Andrés R. is the father of a seven-year-old child who is of school age. The requested loan is to be used for the purchase of construction materials like cement, sand and zinc for his house, and to cover the cost of medication for one of his children. Don José R. says that he has used all the money he has borrowed from Ceprodel to improve his house, and he has improved it in line with his income and the loans granted him.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and family expenses

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina K. is currently in the business of selling maize, millet, and sorghum at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour and dried cassava tubers to sell.

Celina is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her cereals.

loans.use: To stock maize flour and dried cassava tubers to sell.

loans.name: Unis

texts.en:
Unis P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread at home. She is requesting a loan to stock firewood and more bags of charcoal to sell. 

Unis is 42 years old and married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock firewood and more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Raikan

texts.en:
Raikan K. is the resident of Balykchi, a nice city in the Isykul region.  She is 45 years old, married, and she has a son who is sixteen and studies at school.  She is a farmer. She cultivates different fruits and vegetables. In order to make money she sells some part of the harvest. Her husband works as a private driver.  

Raikan wants to start breeding cattle in order to resell them after fattening. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two bulls for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused micro-finance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls for breeding

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon D. is from the village of Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Sharon is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Sharon owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Sharon has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sharon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sharon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Sharon is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sharon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hanna Jean

texts.en:
Hanna Jean V. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 22 years old. Hanna Jean is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Hanna Jean owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services and her husband as the driver to local community members. Hanna Jean has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hanna Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanna Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Hanna Jean is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Hanna Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Jaime Wather

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padrs en el sector Atusparias del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región y en distrito con mayores índices de pobreza. 

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la comercialización ambulante de frutas, el recorre las diferentes calles de Chiclayo y su distrito ofreciendo su mercadería y ya cuenta con clientela fija, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de sus gastos personales y apoyando a la economía de su familia.

Jaime desea invertir en la compra de más frutas de estación para surtir su negocio y ampliar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es adquirir una moto carguera que le permita movilizarse con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents in the community of Atusparias in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz. It is one of the most populous districts in the region but it is also one of the poorest regions.

For the past ten years he has sold fresh fruit along the streets of Chiclayo and in his neighborhood. He sells his products to a steady client base and the income he earns he uses to cover his personal expenses and he contributes to the family economy.

Jaime wishes to invest in the purchase of more fruit to add variety to his business and see an improvement in his sales and profits. He has requests a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to reach his goal. 

His is a very hard working and responsible person. His goal is to purchase a motorcycle to be able to travel and transport with greater ease.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Mercedes Bolivia

texts.es:
Mercedes de 44 años, trabaja vendiendo comida en un colegio, vive con su esposo e hijo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso. 

Trabaja en un colegio vendiendo comida desde ya mucho tiempo para ayudar con los gastos de su familia a su esposo. Aunque desea tener su propio comedor sigue trabajando porque aun no tiene el dinero necesario para ello. Una de las dificultades de su trabajo es la distancia que tiene el colegio a su casa ya que tiene que ir en los buses urbanos.    

Su casa es de ladrillos y desea construirla mejor para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y pintura. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un local de venta de comidas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old and she sells food in a school; she lives with her husband and son in a zone called Paraiso located in the outskirts of the city.

She has been selling food in a school for a long time to help her husband with the family expenses. Although she wishes to have her own eatery, she continues to work because she does not have the necessary money. A difficulty with her job is the distance from her house to the school, since she has to use public transportation.

She has a brick house and she wishes for building improvements so she can offer a better life to her son; with the loan, she wants to buy cement, bricks, and paint. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and have an establishment to sell food.

loans.use: Cement, bricks, paint

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad A. is a 50-year-old man who has raised cattle for the last three years. He is married and has four children. He buys cattle for a profitable price, fattens them and sells to the local butchers or takes them once a week to the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is about 300-400 AZN and he is on the way to increase it to 500 AZN.

As soon as he successfully finished his first loan from Kiva he applied for a new one. He promises to pay it back as well as he did the first one.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee, de 34 años, convive con Fredy de 36 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Jean Carlos de 8 años de edad; al que quieren y protegen en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. El trabajo al que se dedica está empeñosa mujer, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, donde todos los días desde las mañanas hasta el atardecer, Aydee; vende una variedad de productos comestibles a los pobladores de su localidad. Pero como buena pobladora de San Pedro, ella también se dedica al tejido de diversas prendas de vestir a base de lana de algodón y del material dralon. Hace tan solo un año que incursionó en estos negocios, pues según afirma, antes trabajaba en la Municipalidad de Santa Ana, donde ejercía su profesión de Asistenta Social, pero al nacer su hijo, se dedicó de lleno a su crianza; es así que ahora con el trascurrir de los años, ella quiere ampliar su negocio y retomar el ejercicio de su profesión. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como integrante de la junta directiva de su banco comunal, asegura que trabajará con empeño y ahínco en el logro de los objetivos que se proponen como un grupo emprendedor. De conseguir el crédito, está pensando invertir en la mejora de su tienda comprando mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Aydee is 34 years old and lives with Fredy, age 36. They have an eight year old son named Jean Carlos who they love and protect in their own home located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Aydee is an earnest woman who makes a living by selling basic necessities from a space set aside in her house. She works every day from morning to evening. Aydee sells a variety of food products to the good residents of San Pedro. She also weaves different garments made of wool, cotton, and acrylic. According to her, she started these businesses a year ago. She previously worked for the City of Santa Ana as a social worker, but after the birth of her son, she wanted to dedicate herself full-time to raising him. Now that the years have passed, she wants to expand her business and return to her job.

This is her second loan with MFP. As a board member of her Communal Bank, she is determined to work hard to help her group achieve their goals as entrepreneurs. Upon receiving this loan, Aydee will invest in improvements to her store such as buying merchandise to restock her inventory.

loans.use: Restock her store with various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials for an independent sales area in her home

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Selling hair is Phen P.'s current job, which earns his daily income for supporting his family. Phen P. goes around his community purchasing hair from ladies who wish to cut their long hair. He buys it at a reasonable price and sells it to a salon shop in the market for profit. Phen P. uses his old motorbike to travel to other provinces every day. Unfortunately, his existing motor is too old and it often breaks down while driving. For this reason, Phen P. would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorbike to replace his broken one. 

Phen P.’s wife is a local farmer in Kompon Tom province and he has four children. Three children are single and one is married.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike to replace his broken one

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 20 años de edad, soltera; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de ropa para niños y damas, la socia lleva un buen tiempo en este negocio, ella tiene su stand en el comercial El Molino, la socia trae ropa de Desaguadero frontera con Bolivia y a veces viaja hasta Lima para traer mas mercadería, la socia espera más adelante poder estudiar alguna carrera profesional pero por el momento quiere capitalizarse más.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como pantalones, chompas, polos, camisas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 20 and single. She has had a business selling clothing for women and children for some time. She has a stand in the El Molino market. She gets clothing from Desaguadero, on the border with Bolivia, and sometimes she travels all the way to Lima for more merchandise. She hopes to be able to obtain some sort of professional degree in the future, but at the moment she wants to make more money.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise such as pants, sweaters, polos, and shirts, among other items.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: for the purchase of more merchandise such as pants, sweaters, polos and shirts among other items

loans.name: Martin José

texts.es: El Sr. Martin José R. R. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal Carazo desempeñándose como operador de equipo  tiene  treinta y un   años de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Martin José R. R. is employed by the company Enacal Carazo.  He has worked there as an equipment operator for 31 years.  He is married.

He has taken 2 loans previously with CEPRODEL, and with each one he has bought construction materials such as sand, cement, stones, gravel, etc., to use to expand and improve his home.  These loans have benefited him greatly, since through these means he has improved the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone and gravel

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba is a married woman with one child. Her husband is an entrepreneur and his salary isn’t enough to feed their young family. So, understanding that, Matluba learned to sew dresses. Then she bought herself a simple old sewing machine. Matluba started buying fabrics from the market and sewing men's and women’s national dress on demand. But now she understands that her simple sewing machine is not good enough to sew better designed dresses. So Matluba decided to purchase a new sewing machine with better technology and sew better dresses for her clients. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a computer-based sewing machine

loans.name: Celestina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celestina es madre de dos hijos, por el cual se ha esforzado mucho a trabajar como conserje para poder apoyar a sus hijos con lo necesario. Su esposo labora como mensajero y junto han venido ahorrando para la construcción de su casa.
Todo está ah altos costos, y se le hacía difícil comprar todo el material lo que recurre al financiamiento en Afodenic para terminar de cerrar, con este nuevo préstamo hará un pequeño muro perimetral que dará mejor seguridad de su propiedad, como  a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Celestina is mother to two children for whom she has worked very hard as a caretaker in order to support them and cover their needs.  Her husband works as a messenger and together they have been saving up to build their own home.

Everything costs a lot right now and it has been difficult buying all the material.  For this reason, Celestina came to Afodenic to take out a loan in order to finish the work.  She will use this loan to build a small perimeter wall which will provide her property and her young children with more security.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a wall in order to improve the security of her home

loans.name: Erica

texts.es: Erika E. es una mujer de 37 años  que se dedica al comercio de mercancías como calzado ropa, bolsos y accesorios. En su condición de madre trabajadora, tiene un gran sueño y es el de ver   a sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 19 años, convertidos en profesionales muy exitosos , por eso desde que inició su negocio en el año 1990, no ha desistido de esta meta. En un principio tenia  un taller de zapatería muy bien dotado,  donde fabricaba  toda clase de calzado  de muy buena calidad, pero la competencia  empezó a ofrecer estos productos a un mejor precio y por eso cambió de negocio y se dedicó a la comercialización principalmente de productos de cuero  a los cuales fue agregando  otros mas, como ropa y cosméticos, de acuerdo  a lo que sus clientes solicitaban, complementando esta actividad con el servicio de transporte, ingreso con los cuales ha fortalecido el bienestar de sus dos hijos.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ello comprará calzado, bolsos, accesorios, ropa  y cosméticos que han solicitado sus clientes, inversión que  pronostica sea exitosa porque Erika ha tenido experiencia comercial con ellos.
texts.en: Erica E. is 37 and runs a business selling clothing, shoes, handbags and accessories. As a working mother, her dream is to see her children (aged 11 and 19) eventually attain professional success.  Since she began her business in 1990 this dream has guided her. Erica used to have a workshop for making high quality shoes, but competition began to undercut her sales, so she changed to offer other products, especially leather goods, along with clothing and cosmetics, to meet customer requests.  She also has a transport/delivery service, which also contributes to sustain the needs of her family.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to buy inventory of clothing, handbags, shoes, accessories and cosmetics to sell to her clients.  With her knowledge of her client base, Erica foresees great success with this investment.

loans.use: to buy inventory of clothing, handbags, shoes, accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Gabriel se encuentra localizado en L. comunidad D. Amacuitlapilco, Jonacatepec. Está conformado por 10 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes son L. señora Adelina va a comprar cosméticos por mayoreo para vender, L. señora Adelfina va a comprar D. todo tipo D. dulces, L. señora Salustia va a comprar verduras D. temporada para vender, L. señora Minerva va a comprar marranos para criarlos y venderlos, las señoras Maura y María van a comprar alimento para criar sus animales y venderlos, L. señora Blanca va a comprar vasos, gelatinas, para prepararlas y venderlas, L. señora Salustia va a comprar pan por mayoreo para vender en las colonias, L.  señora Martha va a comprar maíz para vender tortillas, L. señora Marilú va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo para vender. L. señora Marilú es integrante del grupo, elL. tiene 33 años D. edad, es casada y tienen 2 hijos Humberto tiene 12 años estudia y Héctor Manuel, elL. tiene su negocio D. ventas D. zapatos por catalogo, elL. solicito su préstamo para comprar sus pedidos D. zapatos, sus clientes son las muchachas y las señoras, elL. sale caminando a ofrecer los zapatos a sus clientes zapatos D. dama, caballero, niños y niñas, elL. inicio su negocio hace 2 años se fue a suscribir  a Jonacatepec, elL. solita aprendió a manejar todo lo del negocio, le intereso vender zapato y está orgullosa cuando le va bien y le pagan obteniendo ganancias, sus planes y esperanzas son seguir vendiendo y quisiera poner un negocio D. zapatos bien establecido y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, elL. está feliz con este préstamo porque va a invertir comprando zapatos, Amacuitlapilco es un pueblo tradicional en el mes D. Marzo celebran el día D. San Gabriel, también festejan el 5º. Domingo D. cuaresma hay procesión en L. tarD., también siembran en temporal sorgo y maíz, y D. riego frijol y calabaza. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por estimular a las personas con sus préstamos ya que nos ayudan mucho para seguir creciendo nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
The solidarity group known as “San Gabriel” is located in the community of Amacuitlapilco, Jonacatepec.  It consists of ten women who known one another and are neighbors.  The members will use their loans in the following manner:

•	Sra. Adelina will buy cosmetics in bulk to sell.
•	Sra. Adelfina will buy all types of candy.
•	Sra. Salustia will buy seasonal vegetables to sell.
•	Sra. Minerva will buy pigs to raise and sell.
•	Sras. Maura and María will buy feed for raising animals to sell.
•	Sra. Blanca will buy glasses and gelatins to prepare and sell.
•	Sra. Salustia will buy bread in bulk to sell in different neighborhoods.
•	Sra. Martha will buy corn for making and selling tortillas.
•	Sra. Marilú will buy shoes in bulk to sell.

Sra. Marilú is a member of the group.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children, Humberto (a 12 year old student) and Héctor Manuel.  Marilú has a business selling shoes through a catalog.  She is requesting a loan so that she can order more shoes.  Her customers are girls and women.  She travels so that she can offer her customers shoes for women, men, and children.  Marilú started this business two years ago by signing up in Jonacatepec.  She asked to learn everything about managing this type of business and became interested in selling shoes.  Marilú is proud that she has done well and is able to generate a profit.  Her hopes and dreams incluD. continuing to sell, having a well-established shoe business, and seeing her children continue their studies.  She is happy to have this loan because she will be able to invest in the purchase of more shoes.  

The town of Amacuitlapilco traditionally celebrates San Gabriel’s Day during the month of March.  In addition, Lent is celebrated on the fifth Sunday with an afternoon procession.  This also happens to be the season for planting sorghum and corn, as well as irrigating the fields of beans and squash.  The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for the encouragement you proviD. through these loans because they have been a great help to people like us who want to continue growing our businesses.”

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 65 years old and married with seven children. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a General Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, groceries, etc in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Mercedita has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as oil, noddles, sardines, etc. In the future Mercedita would like to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
la Sra. Blanca A. A. se dedica a prestar servicios de costurera, Blanca fabrica ropa para cama, cortinas, y cobertores para muebles. su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Flor de Campo, Blanca trabaja de  lunes a domingo comenzando su actividad desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, Blanca viaja cada semana al Comercial Rodolfo y Almacenes La Confianza para comprar mercadería y así mismo viaja a El Salvador cada 10 días para vender de manera ambulante su producto en los lugares de Santa Rosa, Santa Ana, San Vicente y San Miguel. tambien vende sus productos de manera ambulante en colonias La Kennedy, El Hato y La Quezada de la ciudad capital.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus prodcutos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca A. A. is a seamstress. Blanca makes bedding, curtains, and furniture covers. Her business is located in the Flor de Campo suburb and works Monday through Sunday from 9 a.m. until 6 in the evening. Blanca travels each week to the Rodolfo shopping center and La Confianza Stores to buy merchandize and to El Salvador every 10 days to sell products as a roving sales person in Santa Rosa, Santa Ana, San Vicente and San Miguel. She also sells her products in La Kennedy, El Hato and La Quezada neighborhoods in the capital city.

The loan will be used to buy materials to make her products.

loans.use: buy fabrics, threads, cotton, lace, sponges.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José de oficio operador de bombeo en una empresa privada, con veinte años laborando para el bienestar de su familia, sus dos hijas están estudiando y su esposa labora como ejecutiva de ventas. Para poder cubrir los gastos.
Su casa la ido mejorando poco a poco, porque tienen que cubrir los gastos, y ha sido poco el ahorro, es por eso toma la iniciativa de optar al financiamiento para poder estar en mejores condiciones de vivienda.
Este su segundo ciclo, el cual hará división de cuarto y lo ampliara, ya que es pequeño, comprando bloques, cemento, arena y hierro. Lo que vendrá a dar más espacio y comodidad a sus hijos. Con el crédito anterior logro cambiar todo el techo, lo que es de gran avance mediante este medio.
texts.en:
José works as a pump operator for a private firm.  He’s been working for twenty years for his family’s wellbeing.  His two daughters are studying and his wife works as a sales executive to cover expenses.

He has been improving his house little by little because he has to cover expenses and he’s had little savings.  Because of this he took the initiative to opt for financing so that his dwelling can be in better condition.

This is his second cycle.  He will divide and enlarge a room since it’s small buying concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron rods.  This will create more space and comfort for his children.  He used the previous loan to replace the entire roof which was a huge step forward through this means.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a welding machine and provide operating capital

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. Her husband supports her in the business and others family needs. Naomi buys and sells fuel (kerosene, petrol and diesel) and molasses. Naomi has been in this business for the last nine years. She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Limited, to buy more stock of fuel to sell.

Naomi dreams and hopes for her business to grow well so that she will be able to pay back her loan. She hope to be able to save enough to buy a plot of land in order for her to built residential houses for renting.

loans.use: to purchase stock fuel to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very humble-natured lady. She always behaves well with everyone. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and also manages her embroidery business efficiently. Her business returns show good profit which allows her to manage the household expenses. 

She crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes which helps her in attracting many customers to her. Her clientele base is her community ladies who give her regular orders due to her neat and good work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and increase her profits. She is hopeful that her business will expand further and increase her income.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 26 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora; que vive en compañía de su mamá y su papá, a los que quiere y cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde que tenía 20 años de edad, se dedicó a la agricultura, siendo sus principales cultivos la papa y arveja; lo que más le gusta de su labor es poder cuidar de su becerra mientras limpia la maleza que crece entre sus sembríos, pero lo que no le gusta son las temporadas donde los agricultores cosechan gran cantidad de hortalizas, ya que saturan el mercado y no le permite tener buenas ganancias. Pero es en está temporada que ella deja secar la arveja, la cual se convierte en semilla, vendiendo el saco de semilla a un mayor precio en el mercado central de Tarma, permitiéndole estabilizar su economía. Además de dedicar su tiempo libre en la enseñanza a niños menores de 5 años de edad como profesora. Comenta que como mujer joven, el papel que cumple su banco comunal en su vida, es preponderante, ya que le ayuda a crecer y forjarse nuevas metas. Por todos lo aciertos está pensando abrir un restaurante en su zona, ya que no existe una. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera una vez más de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Además se compromete en ser puntual en sus cuotas. Elizabeth de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja que sembrará dentro de poco, además de varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito está temporada agrícola.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 26 years old.  She is a single and hard-working woman who lives with her mom and dad who she loves and cares for in their own home which is located in the small village of Cumutay.

Elizabeth has been farming since she was 20 years old.  Her main crops are potatoes and peas.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to care for her calf while she is getting rid of the weeds that grow amongst her crops.  What she doesn't enjoy are the seasons when farmers harvest a large quantity of vegetables as they flood the market and don't allow her to make good profits.  However, during such seasons she leaves her peas to dry and turns them into seeds.  She then sells the sacks of seeds for a better price in the central market in Tarma.  This allows her to stabilize her finances.  In addition, Elizabeth also spends her spare time teaching children under the age of 5.  She tells us that, as a young woman, her community bank plays a dominant role in her life since it helps her to grow and forge new goals.  Elizabeth is planning to open a restaurant in her area as there isn't one right now.

Elizabeth is a member of the 'Pioneros de Cumutay' (Cumutay Pioneers) community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She hopes, once more, to receive your support in helping her achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, Elizabeth will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds which she will sow shortly.  She will also buy several sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can make a successful start to this season.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en:
Dzendere is a married woman with ten children, five of whom attend school while five already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are fuel and food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a palm wine selling business, selling to her neighbors. In addition she also sells fresh water to her neighbours which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish a club in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to start a clothes selling business, and will purchase bundles of secondhand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es:
Sonia, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 20, 28 y 30 años, ella se dedica a la venta de especias y esencias, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años, surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de esencias, especias y ropa: blusas, faldas, camisas formales, y ropa interior, esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y tener mejor capacidad para atender la demanda.
Ella tiene el propósito de ayudar a sus hijos, estar pendiente de cualquier necesidad que se les presente, y que con la inversión pueda tener mejor capacidad de venta.
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother of three children ages 20, 28 and 30 years old.  She makes her living selling spices and essences.  She has had this business for 20 years.  She started it up on her own initiative.  She is open from 7:00am to 4:00pm.
Sonia currently needs a loan to purchase essences, spices and clothing: blouses, skirts, formal tops and undergarments.  This loan will help her to strengthen the business and to have a greater capacity to meet the demand.
Sonia intends to help her children, to be aware of any need that may come up.  And with the loan, she'll be able to have a greater sales capacity.

loans.use: to purchase essences, spices and clothing: blouses, skirts and formal tops.

loans.name: Ngeima Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Ngeima” group from Kenema, a city  in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The 36-year-old is married to a teacher and they have three children.  Fatmata has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells market-food – salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), flour, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy salt, Maggi, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy salt, Maggi, flour, sugar, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es: Anatolia, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 41 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 46 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle  un futuro prometedor. Anatolia viene realizando la actividad del agro hace 23 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  porque gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus cultivos de cacao y café ella adquirió más espacios de terreno para cultivar y también compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se cobijan los miembros de su familia. Pero en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Anatolia cuenta con una hectárea de terreno sin cultivar, por lo cual necesariamente requiere el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar a cabo sus actividades programadas. Ella tiene pensado repoblar sus fincas con más plantas de cacao y es por ello que acude a los préstamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante a sus hijos y cultivos. Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP y por ello espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes y se compromete en pagar puntualmente su pago ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos futuros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará más semillas de cacao para poder repoblar sus fincas.
texts.en:
Anatolia is 41 years old and a native of Quimbiri. She is a modest and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Benjamín, age 46, and their three beloved children from whom she wants to provide a promising future. Anatolia has been farming for 23 years. With great care and effort, she grows cacao and coffee. As a result of her production, she was able to acquire more space for growing these crops. Whenever she has to remove weeds or harvest her crops, Anatolia hires laborers to help with these tasks so that the work gets completed faster and she can stay on schedule. She purchased another piece of land where she currently lives with her family.

Anatolia has one hectare of land that has not been cultivated, so she needs capital for planting cacao. For this reason, she has approached MFP since the organization provides loans to people of limited resources who are looking to make progress. For the sake of her work, she hopes to bring the same level of effort and energy that she demonstrates when she is raising her children.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she hopes to receive the necessary assistance so that she can accomplish her goals. Anatolia promises to complete her payments on time, just as she did with her previous loans. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more cacao seeds so that she can increase her plantings.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 21-year-old young man. He is a construction worker and is looking to increase his income to pay for his wedding expenses in the future. Jehad has his own business which is raising sheep to sell their products. He wants to purchase more sheep to raise, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

With this loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, Jehad will buy more sheep and increase sales from their products. This will increase his income and lead to better living conditions for him. 

Jehad is in the photograph.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more sheep.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 47-year-old married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 23 years old.

Nelia is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing and selling rice for over 10 years. Nelia has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. Nelia hopes to be progressive in life. She also desires for her children to finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Adelein Conception

texts.en:
Adelein Conception is from the village of Lalog 1, Luna, Isabela.  She is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, she raises and harvests corn for sale.  Adelein Conception has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month.

Adelein Conception joined ASKI to gain access to financial services, improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim, 50 years old, is a pig feeder who earns $5 per day. Her husband sells palm products and also earns $5 per day. There are no children staying with them. Every month, Nim has to spend $45 on food and $20 on transportation. She wants to feed more pigs with modern techniques so that she can earn more income. Besides feeding pigs, she also makes palm sugar to sell with her husband.

Nim would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Segundo Edison

texts.es:
Segundo Edison tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre  tiene una hija , vive con la esposa y con la hija de tres años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener una casa propia para vivir tranquilo con la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Edison, 27, is in a common law relationship and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office; it has 14 members, both men and women.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farmers.

Segundo is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer. His sales and his purchases take place in Chillanes Canton.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because it will improve his quality of life.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is to have a house of his own to live in peace with his family.  In his free time he enjoys going on family excursions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Andalala Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Andalala Group in Western Kenya! Emanuel is the facilitator of the Andalala group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Emanuel takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Emanuel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Emanuel was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emanuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Emanuel will save for the future and pay bank loans.

In 2012, the members of Andalala group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Emanuel and his group members appear in the photograph above. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has been involved in the agricultural business for almost twelve years. He is happy because he is able to manage his one hectare of rice fields. Bernard enjoys his farming activity, so he is determined to improve his rice production.  He is a young farmer and yet still single. 

Bernard's main priority is to prepare his farm land properly so that he can obtain a good rice crop.  Though he feels pain through the sun's heat still he endures it because he would like to help to provide for his family's living.  

Bernard would like to purchase farm supplies such as certified seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and payment towards the labour costs of tilling the farmland and transplanting crops to rice fields but his income is not enough to afford this.  So, for this reason, he is requesting financial assistance amounting to PHP 40,000.  He is hoping that this amount will help him to increase his yields and generate greater income to provide the basic necessities and save some money for security purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as certified seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and payment towards the labour costs of tilling the farmland and transplanting crops to rice fields.

loans.name: Bidii Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Bidii Farmers Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Daniel as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Daniel takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Daniel had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daniel and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, he will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Bidii Farmers group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mercelina

texts.en:
Mercelina is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. She faces a major challenge of school fees and rent bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the local market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a motorcycle business which earns her other income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her operations.  Mercelina dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase another "boda boda" (motorcycle) for her transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase another "boda boda" (motorcycle) for transport business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, aged 32 years, is a businessman who runs a spare auto parts shop that has been operating for five years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes. 90,000.

This is his first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  He will use the funds to buy more spare auto parts to sell.  Samuel hopes to open another spare auto parts store in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a single woman who has no children yet. She describes herself as a promising and jovial woman. 
Nancy operates a a retail stall where she sells passion fruits. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located near a busy road and her main customers are residents in her home area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the times when passion fruits go out of season resulting in a shortage. She will use her loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more passion fruits. Nancy's business goal is to buy a pick-up to aid in delivery of passion fruits within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more passion fruits.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Ms Tam is 38 years old with 3 children of school age. She  has been running a small restaurant that serves breakfast for the last 3 years. In addition, she grows cheery blossom for the Tet holidays. Joining in our credit program in 2003, she used the loan she undertook effectively to expand her business activities. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam Dong to buy kitchens equipment and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy kitchens equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio tiene la edad de 48 años, es asalariado del gobierno y con lo que gana apenas le alcanza para hacer algunas mejoras en la vivienda, priorizando las mas necesaria, habita junto a su esposa con quien procreo tres hijos todos son mayores de edad y la menor habita con ellos, ademas se preocupa por sus nietos que también lo visitan.  Don Julio desde que tiene su trabajo fijo se ha propuesto en mejorar cada día su humilde vivienda, haciendo créditos a Afodenic mediante kiva es así como las mejoras se han hecho posible, pues embaldoso la sala, reparó parte del techo y otras mejoras que ha venido haciendo con muchas dificultades por su nivel de ingreso.

Nuevamente se remite a Kiva a solicitar este préstamo que sera invertido en reparar la letrina hacerle paredes de concreto, ya que en la actualidad es de zing y está con hoyos,  cambiar el techo y otras mejoras que necesita para poder gozar de un buen servicio higiénico que muestre las condiciones para hacer sus necesidades cómodamente.

Su próxima meta es ayudar siempre a su anciana madre y continuar con las mejoras en el hogar con otro crédito si Dios le concede estos deseos.

loans.use: hacerle paredes de concreto y cambiar el techo a la letrina, ademas reparar interiormente esta misma, para asegurar la buena higiene en el hogar.

loans.name: Tại's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tại is 55 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Tại lives in Tinh Gia district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Tại faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.
Although this is Tại first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all member agree to vote her to be group leader.
With her business profit, Tại hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Madam Josephine’s kenkey has always been enjoyed by the people in her community. She prepares her kenkey under very good hygienic conditions and therefore it is very attractive for buyers. She however needs capital to produce more to meet the high demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $750.00 from Kiva. She can work very hard with this amoount and pay back the loan.

loans.use: working capital to expand her kenkey selling business

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Mrs Xuan’s husband left her for another woman. She is supporting a child by herself. The child is 16 years old and in grade 8. Mrs Xuan has a small hut with wooden walls and a clay floor. She has a small rice field of about 280 m2. She also buys waste daily for recycling and then sells it to a a small business in the commune. Additionally, she raises pigs at her house.

Mrs Xuan borrowed an interest-free loan of $100 and has already repaid the loan. Her income increased $2.50 per person per month. Now the average income is $10 per person per month. Mrs Xuan wants another loan of $100 for expanding her business.

loans.use: Selling recycled waste and raising pigs.

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.en:
Jessenia has a small business where she sells many different types of products. At her store, she sells school and office supplies, home products and also bottled water. In this sector clean water is difficult to come by, therefore Jessenia has a very high rate of demand for that product.

Jessenia hopes to invest the loan by improving the inventory in her store. Although the water sales do well, she is hoping she can generate more income with completely different products.

With this loan Jessenia is confident the situation for her and her three children will improve. She currently lives in a cement home and she saves towards the future of her children.

loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak S. is 38 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 7 children.  She works selling vegetables, a job that earns her $4/day of income.  Her husband is a fisherman, and earns $3/day.  One of Mrs. Sak S.'s sons is a moto-taxi driver, and she will use this loan to purchase a motorbike for him.  This will increase his income, as well as the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son's business

loans.name: Elio Obet

texts.es:
Elio is a very responsible and hard working man. He has been living in a civil union for three years and moved to Reynosa, Tamaulipas seeking for better opportunities. Motivated by the lack of employment and a desire to give the best to his young daughter, he opened his own grocery store. Fortunately he was able to pull it through and make it grow little by little increasing the variety of products he sells.

In order to continue growing and serve the demand of his clientèle, Elio needs a loan for $250 which he is committing to pay back in 4 months. Today is the time to help. Elio needs of your help and is thankful for the trust you give him.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Elio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en unión libre y desde hace tres años, en busca de mejores oportunidades llegó a Reynosa, Tamaulipas e inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes motivado por la falta de empleo y el deseo de darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija que acababa de nacer, afortunadamente logró sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer poco a poco incrementando la variedad de productos que comercializa.

Para poder continuar creciendo y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes Elio necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a regresar en un plazo de 4 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, Elio necesita de tu ayuda y agradece la confianza que le depositas.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Investimento Group

texts.pt:
The Investimento Group has 3 members: Maria Talvina, president of the Group, Maria Gilda and Helena N.. The group was formed in 2006 by Maria Talvina and Maria Gilda, who were the sole members at the time. Helena joined them just this year. All the members sell used clothing at Limpopo, one of the markets in the surrounding areas of the city of Xai-Xai. They all have children and live with their husbands. With the money from the loan, they would each like to buy more bundles of used clothing for resale, as used clothing sells very well at the Limpopo market. Maria Talvina would like to take 6,160 MT, Maria Gilda 5,120 MT and Helena 6,160 MT. Each would like to repay her loan within 4 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

o Grupo Investimento tem 3 membros a saber Maria Talvina que e a Presidente do Grupo, Maria Gilda e Helena N..O grupo foi formado em 2006. Eram na altura apenas 2 membros as sras Maria Talvina e Maria Gilda. A sra Helena juntou-se a elas ainda este ano. Todas elas vendem roupa usada no mercado Limpopo. Um dos mercados nas redondezas da Cidade de Xai-Xai. Todas elas tem filhos e vivem maritalmente com os seus maridos. Com o dinheiro do emprestimo querem cada uma comprar mais fardos de roupa usada para a venda uma vez que roupa usada tem muita saida no mercado Limpopo.Maria Talvina quer tomar 6.160,00 Mt, Maria Gilda quer tomar 5,120,00 Mt e a Helena quer tomar 6.160,00 Mts.Todas elas querem pagar em 4 meses

loans.use: The members of the Investimento group would like to use the loan money to buy more bundles of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Z. lives with her husband and children in their own home in Lourdes, Colon. She has a small shop in the home where she sells groceries, drinks and candy. With the income this generates she's is able to help with the household expenses. She will use this loan to stock the store with the products customers have requested but which she didn't have the funds to buy.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Z. actualmente vive en casa propia en Lourdes, Colon ,la señora tiene una tienda, en su vivienda, en la cual vende productos de consumo y golosinas ,su aporte con el negocio le sirve para poder cubrir parte de los gastos familiares y así poder ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su hijos su propósito con el crédito es comprar algunos productos que los clientes buscan pero que por falta de dinero no a podido comprar, con este crédito surtiría sus estantes y así podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Hadayat's Group

texts.en: I am a mother of seven: five daughters and two sons. My husband and my elder son construct building and my younger son is a rickshaw driver.  Now, my son plans to buy a small truck to transport goods from one place to another for which we request a loan.  Parween B. will use the loan in their cycle repair shop. Basheeran M. requests this loan to buy stock for their general store. Zareen K. will use the money to buy an additional video game for their video games club.

loans.use: To buy a small truck

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old and is married with one child, age 6. Mariam owns a food vendor store, which she started in 2005. She works every day from 6 am to 5 pm at her business.

In the past, Mariam has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros E., 51, is a widow and has a business selling banana ice cream (the ice cream is mixed with banana) in her community. She normally earns around $12 a day in revenue. She has five children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. Two of her children sell banana ice cream like their mother, earning about $6 a day in revenue. She requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to transfer the ice cream to sell door to door (they now use a bicycle). People like banana ice cream in her village so this business is also lucrative.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to sell banana ice cream.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
Born around 1966 in Ouidah in the Atlantique department, southern Benin, Mrs Virginie B. is married and the mother of four children. The children are cared for by both parents. She sells bags of coal at retail and wholesale. Having run this business for about 20 years, Mrs B. has a great deal of experience in the field. Working in a very competitive sector and lacking the means with which to meet demand, she is requesting this loan to expand her business activities as well as satisfy the ever-growing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1966 à OUIDAH dans le département de l'ATLANTIQUE au sud du BENIN, dame B. Virginie est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Les enfants sont à la charge des deux géniteurs. Elle est une revendeuse en détail comme en gros de sacs de charbon. Exerçant cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années, dame B. Virginie est dotée d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine. Opérant dans un secteur concurrentiel et les moyens insuffisants pour répondre favorablement à la demande, elle sollicite ce prêt pour étendre son secteur d’activités et aussi pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 50 bags of coal

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
Adrian Sambrana is a married man with two children and the duty to provide them with everything needed for their development. He has a photography business and his own studio in this house and clients that want photographs for various purposes. He also works outside of the studio if his clients require it.

Since he started the business ten years ago he has managed to improve the living conditions in his family. Today he is requesting a loan at CEPRODEL in order to improve his studio as well as his darkroom where he develops his photos. That's why he trusts that he will receive his loan without any problems.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Adrian Sambrana es un caballero casado y con dos hijos con el deber de brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo por ser menores de edad. Este caballero se dedica al negocio de la fotografía teniendo su propio estudio en su casa de habitación donde es visitado por clientes que desean tomarse fotos para diversos fines. Además trabaja ambulante si así se lo requiere algún cliente.

Desde que inicio este negocio hace diez años ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para la mejora del local del estudio fotográfico y además para el revelado de las fotografías. Por eso es que confía en que recibirá el crédito sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: To improve his photography studio

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente is a very hard-working person who does agricultural work in Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. The cirumstances he has gone through since several years ago have made him work very hard to put bread on the table every day in his humble home. Committed to his family to improve their quality of life and due to the fact that their community is very remote, he doesn't have electricity, and he has requested the implementation of a solar panel to obtain it.
