Rebecca baji wants a loan to buy a handset for her PCO (which people use to make calls and pay by the minute) public call office. Sardaran baji and Majeedan baji each want a loan to buy wheat on wholesale to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, que sobre todo le brindan apoyo. La casa donde ella habita es propia. Es propietaria de un mocarro y a la vez vende ropa (recientemente) por las diferentes zonas de su región. La moto que tiene cuenta con un año de funcionamiento y brinda servicio de taxi, ganancias con las cuales puede sustentar sus gastos diarios. Este motocarro lo maneja uno de sus hijos, el mismo que se encarga de cuidarlo y mantenerlo. Doris está contenta porque tanto el motocarro como la venta de ropa le generan buenos ingresos, por lo que le va muy bien, y ahora tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de abarrotes. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita mandará a reparar su moto para que trabaje al 100 %, así como también construirá un kiosco para poner posteriormente una bodega.
texts.en:
Doris is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her three children, who are grown up and have families but support her above all. She is the owner of a motorcoach and at times recently has sold clothing in the different areas of the region. She has had her motorcoach for a year, providing taxi services so she can afford her daily expenses. One of her children drives the vehicle, and he also cares for and maintains it. Doris is content because just like the motorcoach, her clothing sales have gone well and generate good income, and now she is planning to start a new business selling grocery items. This is her eighth loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she plans to use the money she is requesting to repair her motorcoach so it works 100 percent. She also plans to build a kiosk where she can later install her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcoach

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
14 people living in Phum Ty 8 village in Kampong Chhnang province and comprise this village bank loan. They hope to use the loan for a variety of purposes. 

Mrs. Mao P. is a 37 year-old village bank president. She breeds chickens and pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wishes to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan that will allow her to buy more chickens and piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keo Mono, is a farmer who owns a plot of land of which he uses to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a laborer. Mrs. Mao P. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and piglets to breed and thereby earn more income.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian A. is a 29 year old mother of three children and is pursuing her first loan. Currently she is working in a salon but is hoping to use the loan to start her own business. Her three children are all in school and she is raising them on her own. She says the grestest challenge in starting her business is access to capital. She is fortunate as her children are in government schools and she does not have to pay their fees.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and blowdryers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 26, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers 3 days per week. This is Maria's first loan with SPBD, and she will use it to purchase a water hose, pesticides, herbicides, and bush knives for use on the plantation.

SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala ($145 USD).

loans.use: Purchase water hose, gromozones, pesticides, weedkiller, and bushknives.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Danaya avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. .
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente pagnes wax, d’orange,  de savon et  de bois de chauffe.  
Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles l’ont sollicité afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 20 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges ,10 cartons de savons et 15 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et au Burkina faso, pays frontalier du Mali. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Comprising six married women, the members of the Danaya group are on average 35 years old with 3 children and live in monogamous households in Médine, one of the areas of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses, which include among others the sale of pagnes wax (a type of highly-values West African cloth), oranges, soap, and firewood. They are on their fourth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They turned to this institution in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele, which is constantly increasing. With this loan, they intend to buy 15 sets of pagnes wax, 20 100-kg sacks of oranges, 10 boxes of soap, and 15 cartloads of firewood. They supply themselves at the grand market of the city of Sikasso and in Burkina Faso, a country bordering Mali. Their merchandise is sold at the Sikasso grand market and often door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, with most of the sales in cash. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 17,000 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used for their families' needs and the remaining portion invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Vicenta es viuda, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Vicenta vende golosinas, bebidas, de manera ambulatoria cerca de un colegio particular, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, actividad que raliza de lunes a sábado.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Vicenta sueña con tener un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales,
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Maria Celeste community bank. Vincenta, 42, is a widow, and she has 2 children. Vicenta is a street vendor who sells sweets and drinks near a private school. She uses a tricycle and sells from Monday through Saturday. Vicenta needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy sweets and soft drinks. Vicenta dreams of having a stable location and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and soft drinks

loans.name: Mukhtayaran Aslam Masih Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran baji is a very sensible and hardworking lady. She runs a business sewing clothes, which she handles and manages very successfully. Due to the economic conditions in Pakistan, she sews clothes so that she can save income for a rainy day. Mukhtayaran baji's husband runs a business selling bed sheets. For the past three years, he has bough sheets from Lahore and sold them in his native city of Vehari. Mukhtayaran baji is applying for a loan to buy bed sheets for her husband’s business.

Mukhtayaran baji is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Nasreen akhtar baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Naziran baji wants a loan to buy items (such as creams, cosmetics and a hairdryer machine) for her parlor. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her dressmaking business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Mirsaid

texts.en:
Mirsaid M. is 60 years old, married, and has four adult children. For 14 years Mirsaid has been developing agricultural production on his land with the help of his wife and children. Now planning to sow potatoes on his land, he is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase potato seed and mineral fertilizer for processing the land. You could play an important part in Mirsaid’s family's life; he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ribbim

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1970, O. Ribbim now lives with his wife and their 4 children. They are also responsible for caring for his elderly parents. Ribbim is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Ribbim would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 8000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his crop. The income from the sale of this crop will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and to educate all his children to a higher level of education. Ribbim is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. has been a member of ASHI since 2007. She and her husband Antonio are 41 years old and have three children. Their eldest two children are in high school, while the third one is an elementary student. Education of these three incurs a lot of expenses for Josephine and her husband to deal with. Her husband is a bus "conductor" (someone who is in charge of collecting passengers' fares and will command the driver to stop when passenger wants to ride or step off the bus), while Josephine has been making and selling "nipa" shingles. 

"Nipa" shingles is the most affordable roofing material in the province. This material is good for two to three years before it gets rotten. Poor people all over the province of Antique and those who live in very remote areas like the place where Josephine and her family live, can only afford this kind of roofing material. Therefore, Josephine thought of starting such a business. She will also be maximizing the resources which her village and community offers, because the "Nipa" plant is everywhere and a lot of people make "Nipa" shingles, however, they don't have access to marketing their product outside their village.

Josephine wanted to address the issue faced by most poor people in their community. She started to grow her own business through loans she received from ASHI and she will still be expanding further by purchasing the products of people in her community to market in places outside their own village. Her loan will make this happen and will contribute to the improvement of the lives of poor people.

loans.use: To purchase nipa (kind of palm used in making shingles for rooves) leaf, and nipa shingles to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 42 años, vive con su esposa Jeny y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de mascotas en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Lima, donde ofrece lindos perritos, hámster, gatos, tortugas, etc. Ella optó por este negocio porque siempre le gustaron mucho los animales y lo que más disfruta es pasar tiempo con ellos, es por eso que su trabajo no se le hace muy pesado; aunque la parte difícil radica en que algunas veces las mascotas adquieren alguna enfermedad y debe poner sumo cuidado en su atención. A Ricardo le hubiera gustado ser veterinario, pero ve en su trabajo lo que más se asemeja a ese sueño. Felizmente su esposa y su hijo comparten ese mismo amor por los animales, así que siempre trabajan juntos para de salir adelante. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará perros de raza Shitzú para criar y luego los venderá a un precio mayor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 42 years old and lives with his wife Jeny and their young son in their own house. For 4 years, he has sold animals in the Central Market in the city of Lima, where he offers beautiful puppies, hamsters, cats, turtles, etc. He decided to pursue this business because he always liked animals. What he enjoys most is spending time with them. Because of this, his work doesn’t make him very tired. The difficult part of his business is that sometimes the animals become ill and he must take care of them. Ricardo would have liked to be a veterinarian, but his work is the most similar to this dream. Happily, his wife and son share his love for animals, so they always work together to go forward. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he has been very punctual in all of his repayments. With the money that he is now requesting, he will buy Shitzu dogs to raise and, later, sell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B., from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin, is 43 years old and the married mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business in the manufacturing sector, its main source of income coming from making house furniture for sale in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase materials for furniture making. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik T. is 48 years old. He lives with his wife in Sevan. Gagik has a secondary education. For the last 4 years he has worked as a foreman and 4 months ago Gagik and his wife began their own business that brings in 90,000 Armenian dram (about $239 US) per month. They have a rented shop, where they sell a mix of products. Gagik and his wife want to receive a 200,000 AMD loan to buy coffee, sugar and sunflower-seed oil to expand their start-up business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar and sunflower-seed oil

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad (comestibles), la cual atiende esmeradamente todos los días. Ocasionalmente, sus pequeños hijos la apoyan en la atención, ya que su tienda está en su misma casa, pues aprovechó se que encuentra ubicada en una carretera muy transitada de su localidad. Es así que Domitila se preocupa por tener productos novedosos que atraigan a mayor cantidad de público y con la buena atención que brinda a su clientela ha logrado aumentar sus ventas, las cuales se traducen en el crecimiento de su negocio. Uno de los proyectos a futuro de Domitila es tener un minimarket que abastezca de diversos productos a sus clientes.
Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y se compromete a seguir adelante con el mismo ánimo. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la ampliación del espacio de su tienda, para ello comprará pintura y contratará al personal que hará las remodelaciones. Así también, usará otra parte de dinero en la compra de mercadería en arroz y azúcar.

loans.use: Ampliación de su tienda e incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Elvio

texts.en: Elvio Barrios is a storekeeper and dedicates himself to selling direct billing merchandise. He started in the area with his father and and earned enough savings to open his own business. Elvio’s dream is to open a commercial shop where he can exhibit his merchandise to sell. He will use this loan to buy merchandise such as electronics, power saws and other things. Elvio is 28 years old, single and lives with his brothers and mother.

loans.use: To buy electronics and tools

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer activa y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 72 años, madre D. ocho hijos, todos mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segundo uso en el mercado D. Bellavista, en este negocio también participa su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Innovadoras” desD. hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosa y golosinas para vender.
Ahora Isabel necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar ropa D. segunda por fardos. La meta D. Isabel es tener una tienda D. artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Isabel is an active woman who works well with others. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 72 years old and the mother of eight children, all of whom are adults. Isabel sells second hand clothing in the Bellavista market together with her husband. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Innovadoras” for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in soft drinks and sweets to sell. Now Isabel needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy bundles of second hand clothing. Her goal is to have a home goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. is 23 years old and resides with her husband and one young child in Takeo province. She and her husband make and sell piggy banks to earn a living and are able to make about US$2 profit each day. To earn additional income, Seng S. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to raise pigs.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Pay for servicing and maintanance charge of the machines.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma de 37 años de edad, cuenta con una frutería y verdulería en el centro mismo de la ciudad de independencia, nediante la miama le ayuda a su cónyuge quien es el señor José Ortiz de 34 años de edad. Se dedican al rubro desde hace mas de 1 año, el negocio comenzó siendo muy precaria, actualmente cuenta con una casita, frente a la ruta principal de la colonia Independencia, cuenta con variedades de frutas y verduras, (locote, tomate, cebolla, naranja, pera, sandia, etc.).

Solicita dicho monto para la compra de mercaderías ya que cada día acuden al local clientes exigentes de toda la zona, alemanes y paraguayos por el buen servicio prestado y la calidad de las mercaderías.
texts.en:
Zulma, 37, sells fruits and vegetables in downtown Independencia. Her husband, José Ortiz, 34, helps her. They have been in this line of work for more than a year. The business had a very precarious beginning but now, she has a small shed, on the main street of Independencia neighborhood. She has a variety of fruits and vegetables such as: "locote" (pepper), tomato, onion, oranges, pears, watermelon, etc. She seeks funding to buy merchandise because local customers from the area, both german and paraguayan, come to her for the good customer service and high quality of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (fruits & vegetables).

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro M. G. tiene 58 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Ellos tienen 20 y 17 respectivamente y los dos viven en la casa con su esposa.  El crédito lo quiere para comprar de terneras para que sirvan de cría. El puede obtener mejor ganancias con la venta de las crías. Hace muchos años que el ha dedicado a  la ganadería y quiere crecer. Es la trecer  vez don Ramiro se financia con FUDECOSUR, en el pasado obteniendo montos de 100000 y 200000 colones. Estos prestamos le han ayudado a permiten salir adelante por la forma de trabajo en que operan. El es el presidente del comite de credito de Platanares.  El espera que tenga un buen bienestar economico que le permita ayudar a la familia y el estudio de los hijos. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ramiro M. G. is 58 years old, married, and has two children who are his highest priority. They are 20 and 17 years old respectively, and both live at home with him and his wife. This loan will be used to buy calves for breeding. He hopes to obtain better earnings upon selling the offspring. Ramiro has been raising livestock for several years and wants his business to grow. This is the third time he has received financing from FUDECOSUR. His previous loans were in the amounts of 100,000 and 200,000 colones, and have allowed him to stay ahead and keep his business in operation.

Ramiro currently serves as president of the Platanares Communal Bank. He hopes his family will be in a good financial situation to enable his children to continue their studies.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for breeding

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 33 years old and married with two children, both in primary school. Her husband works with an electricity company in Benin City, Edo State.

Kate sells colorful sarongs and she also makes lovely designs for her customers. She has been in this business for seven years. She loves her tailoring skills because it enables her make more profits to support her home.

Kate is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to own a fashion shop in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Woly

texts.fr: Woly D. est âgée de 49 ans, elle mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et été 4 fois bénéficiaire de prêts. Elle fait de l'élevage de moutons, d'arachide, et de haricots. Elle participe aux charges collectives de sa famille.
texts.en:
Woly D. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has been a recipient of loans four times. She raises sheep, and she grows peanuts and beans. She takes part in covering the collective expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial businesses

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married and has 7 children. She is 48 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She sells Nigerian and Ghanaian cooked food. She has been in this business for a long time. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Big Five Marketer Group

texts.en:
Big Five Marketer is a group of 5 borrowers led by Daniel S.. He is 48 years old and is married with a big family.  Daniel is a high school graduate but could not continue with school due to a lack of financial support.

For more than 10 years, Daniel has been selling general goods and palm oil at the Joe Bar Market near Liberia's capital Monrovia. Daniel encourages customers to buy from him by selling high quality goods and palm oil. Daniel will use this loan to purchase more palm oil.  He dreams of giving his children a good future by sending them to school and building a house for his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Daniel is the one holding the sign.  Mamie P. is inset at the lower right of the photo.   This is the second time that Daniel's group has been listed on Kiva -- see the first listing here: http://www.kiva.org/lend/141616. 

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil.

loans.name: Mehanbidi

texts.ru: Адинаев Механбиди проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает в России. Сам Механбиди занимается живоноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. В этой области более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mehanbidi A. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 55 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Their son works in Russia. Mehanbidi is involved in animal husbandry and has a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. He has over 20 years of experience in this field. Mehanbidi is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
For a hospitable woman like Elena C., gaining a lot of customers for their blacksmith business isn’t hard. It is meeting their increasing demands and the need to expand plus the increasing financial needs of her family that worries her.

For this reason, Elena and her husband decided to request a much larger loan through ASHI. Once their blacksmith shop becomes stable, in addition to her hog-breeding business, Elena believes that they will also be able to sustain the education of their children who are in college and will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for manufacturing bolos (large single-edged knives) and other knives

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Two of his children, aged 21 and 18, are university students. His third son, Munhsaihan, is 15 years old and attends a local secondary school. Batsaihan operates an auto repair service which he started in 2000 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 362 USD). After ten years he has managed to increase his working capital to more than 4,500,000 tugrugs (~ 3252 USD). He has built a loyal customer base because of the good quality of his work and service. After saving his profits for many years he was able to build his own auto garage and repair center. Batsaihan is an honest person and has good communication skills. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1445 USD) loan to increase the working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Marta Irene tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 pues siempre se ha preocupado por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene a su cargo a sus hijos, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle lo más necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido caminar largas distancias para ofrecer la variedad de productos que ofrece, ya que solo así puede obtener nuevos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para trajes, cosméticos, calzado y vestidos. Siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda en donde sus clientes se encuentren mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Marta Irene has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and she has always made sure she makes her payments in time. Marta has her children in her care, and always worries about providing them with all the necessary things. Her economic activity is the sale of general groceries. One of her biggest challenges has been walking the long distances to offer the variety of products that she offers, as this is the only way she can get new clients. The loan she is seeking is for working capital and to purchase suits, cosmetics, shoes and clothes. Marta has always dreamt of having a shop where her clients can be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita A., from the village of Sulipat Calamba Misamis Occidental, is 30 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lelita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur Hamidou Ousmane Dramé est un célibataire résidant dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Hamidou Ousmane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études s’est très vite initié à l’activité d’achat et vente de téléphones portables et de leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur,etc.) il y a environ dix ans. 
Son activité est menée dans une boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et surtout de transporteurs. 
Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Il est à son premier prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, à Bamako, 15 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 cartons de façades, 20 chargeurs, 18 paquets de carte mémoire, 4 cartons de batterie, 2 douzaines d’écouteurs etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou Ousmane Dramé was born on October 19, 1988 in Zégoua (at the Mali - Ivory Coast border). He is single and lives in a traditional extended family in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Hamidou Ousmane did not have the opportunity to pursue his schooling. Ten years ago he very rapidly initiated himself to the purchase and sell of mobile phones and their accessories (front covers, batteries, charger, headphones etc…). Hi activity takes place in a shop at the bus station in Sikasso. His customer base is mostly travelers and transporters. He is very much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products. In order to better meet his ever increasing customers’ demand, he decided, a few months ago, to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan and he plans on using it to buy, in Bamako, 15 mobile phones of different brands, 2 boxes of front covers, 20 chargers, 18 packs of memory card, 4 boxes of batteries, 2 dozen headphones etc… With this loan, he is planning to make a monthly profit of 180 000 Francs CFA. It will be used mostly to increase his working capital, to contribute to the family’s expenses and to pay his loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly N. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Jelly owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Jelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business by buying more baby livestock to raise. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by buying more baby livestock

loans.name: Gilma

texts.en:
Gilma T. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Gilma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gilma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector buying & selling of dried foods. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of dried squid and fish in the local community. Gilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gilma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & increased working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a business providing general transportation services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and 3 siblings and contributes with her brothers to the household expenses. She started her business selling lingerie from her home. Today, she is the proud owner of a lingerie shop. She has been working hard in her store for the past four years. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to further diversify her merchandise selection. She hopes that her varied selection of lingerie will continue to generate good profits and enable her to expand her business even further. She expects her productivity and income to increase in the coming year. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to further diversify her merchandise selection

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois M., 28, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products. M. and her husband are blacksmiths and are able to earn an income of USD 10 per day. M.'s husband appears in the photograph because M. was not available.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase more charcoal and metal to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and metal to expand her business

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
This is Melitona P., 58, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Eugenio P. Sr. and mother to three young hard-working adults. By the grace of God, Melitona has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melitona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a  minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Melitona dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Oum's Group

texts.en:
Oum S., a 38-year-old married woman, is the village bank president selected by the 16 members of this village loan located in Daeum Rues village, Kandal province. Each member of this loan group will use his or her portion of the loan for a different purpose. 

Oum S. and her husband, Mr. Oem Ann, sell noodles and groceries from their home and are able to earn some profit to support the family. With both of these businesses, they hope that they can improve their family's living standards. In order to enlarge their business activities and increase their income, Oum S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and noodles. This couple has four childR.: three are seamstresses in the garment factory and O. attends the local school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and noodles

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti T. is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and transport costs. Mwanasiti has operated her tailoring business from home for the last four years.  She faces the major challenge of high competition from other tailoring shops. In the future she would like to build rental houses to increase her income.  Mwanasiti decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from friends. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase a bale of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high. Esi sells fruits like oranges and bananas at Abura. Her husband is a teacher. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of the family’s expenses. Esi will use the loan to purchase more fruit for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest back into her business.

In the picture, she displays the fruits she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Flor De Durazno Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Flor de Durazno  porque  en la casa donde se reúnen hay un árbol que en determinada época del año dan unas flores muy llamativas en forma de racimos color rosa. Está ubicado en Morelos, en México. La  Sra. Margarita C., es originaria de Totolapan, tiene un taller de costura, su familia está conformada por 5 integrantes, sus tres hijos varones, su esposo y ella; su esposo trabaja en el mismo negocio.Ella quiere el crédito para  incrementar sus ventas. El proyecto que tiene con respecto a su negocio es  mejorar  sus ventas para seguir invirtiendo en su taller de costura y con las ganancias que esto le genere  construir un respaldo familiar  económico para ella y su familia, además de lograr comprar una maquina bordadora para su negocio.
Observaciones: La persona que no se ve bien por el reflejo de luz al tomar la foto, es la señora Leticia A. R..
texts.en:
This group is called Flor de Durazno because in the home where they meet there is a tree which, at a certain point in the year, has very striking pink flowers in clusters. The group is located in Moreles, in Mexico. Sra. Margarita C., a native of Totolapan, has a sewing workshop. Her family is made up of 5 members-her three grown sons, her husband, and herself. Her husband works in the same business. She wants the loan in order to increase her sales. Her plan for her business is to improve her sales by continuing to invest in her sewing shop. With the earnings that she generates she plans to build up a base of financial support for herself and her family, as well as to buy an embroidery machine for her business.
Observations: Mrs Leticia A. R. is the person who is not easily visible due to the reflection of the light when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To invest in their business and increase their sales.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ana Francisca; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de préstamo de dinero a sus amigos , vecinos, y familiares ,a la vez  ella realiza prótesis dentales lo cual también lo vende a los consultorios dentales.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para elaborar las prótesis dentales que tiene pendiente para entregar a los consultorios dentales ,ella comprara los materiales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Vamos Juntos” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Ana Francisca. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with a business lending money to her friends, neighbors, and family members. She also makes dental prosthetics and sells them to dental offices.

She is requesting the loan to make the dental prosthetics that she already has orders for so that she can get them to the dentists’ offices. She will buy the materials she needs.

She is grateful to those who are helping her with her dream through this program and she promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To make dental prosthetics that she has orders for so that she can get them to the requesting dentists’ offices; she will buy the materials she needs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida S. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Nida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $145 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Nida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and breads. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & breads

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene  03 hijos.  La señora estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento   Manuela  Ramos desde hace 09 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Con su nuevo crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para comprar mercaderías para su tienda e insumos para la producción de chicha.  En este negocio la ayuda su hija .

Su visión es mejorar el negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en: Fortunata is a member of "Las Kantutas" community bank in the district and province of Puno, Peru. She is 55 years old, married and has three children. She has a third-grade education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past nine years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her general store. With this new loan of 600 soles, she plans to invest in the purchase of supplies for her store as well as ingredients to make chicha (a corn-based alcoholic beverage). Her daughter helps her with the business. Her vision for the future is to improve her business and increase her profits. What she likes about her community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her store and ingredients to make chicha

loans.name: Genipher

texts.en: Genipher is a 45-year-old member of Faulu Kenya under the Tusaidiane group.  She joined the group as a businesswoman who runs a salon.  She was previously employed in a beauty shop before she opened her own business.  She is the mother of three and she works hard to provide for her family.  She hopes to open a wholesale cosmetic shop in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy hair shampoo, hair braids, a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy hair shampoo, hair braids, blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 53 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: raising pigs, operating a tricycle, and selling drinking water. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Rhoda is borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can expand operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rhoda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "dungganon"--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: Expand business operations

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y vive con su familia en el distrito de Paiján, perteneciente a la Libertad, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Él se dedica al transporte.  Tiene como vehículo a un mototaxi (vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior).  Juan es muy conocido en la zona, por lo que la gente prefiere optar por el servicio que él brinda.  Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Juan desea reparar su mototaxi, ya que con el tiempo y el uso se ha venido deteriorando.  Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 750 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old. He is married and lives with his family in the Paiján district, which belongs to La Libertad,  4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

He works in transportation. He has a motorcycle taxi as a vehicle (a vehicle that is made up of a motorcyle and a cabin to transport people in). Juan is well known in the area, and people prefer to use his service. This activity allows him to help support his family in its daily budget.  

Juan wants to repair his motorcyle taxi, since with use and over time is has deteriorated. For this he has decided to ask for a loan of 750 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To maintain his transportation unit

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Virgen de Juquila, se encuentra localizado en barrio San Miguel Cohuecan, estado de Puebla, México, esta integra por 7 mujeres trabajadoras que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Ernestina R. Ramírez va a comprar con su préstamo barro y tierra blanca para elaborar los jarros los vende crudos, la señora Petra Constantina V. M. va a comprar barro para la elaboración de las jarros, la señorita Luisa S. González va a comprar leña, barro, tierra blanca para la elaboración de las ollas y cazuelas, la señora Maura A. V. va a comprar barro, para la elaboración de los jarros rústicos, la señora Diana Martínez López va a comprar medicamentos, antiinflamatorios, jarabes, analgésicos, para surtir su farmacia, la señora Manuela S. S. va a comprar barro, leña, para la elaboración de sus pedestales, la señora Gabina R. A. va a comprar Barro y tierra blanca para elaboración de las cazuelas, la señorita Luisa S. González es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 36 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria obteniendo su certificado, ella es soltera vive con su mama y su hermano ellos se dedica a la alfarería elabora jarros cazuelas y ollas, ella solicito su préstamo para compra leña, barro y greta para surtir su negocio de los insumos y tener material para elaborar los jarros, cazuelas y ollas, ella inicio su negocio hace 28 años, ella veía como cortaba el barro su mama y fue aprendiendo solita, el negocio es familiar ahí trabajan todos los de la familia su negocio está en su casa y es muy importante su negocio porque se mantiene uno de ahí, a ella le gusta trabajar la alfarería elaborar las cazuelas y pintarlas, y está orgullosa porque trabaja, cuando hornea y toda la producción sale bonita, también le ha servido para la mayordomía hay 8 días de fiesta dan de comer a toda la gente, dan los arreglos, las ceras para la Iglesia, sus clientes son de Jaloxtoc, Ahuatlan, Tepetlixpa, su negocio es popular por el buen trabajo y terminado de los jarros, cazuelas y ollas, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el clima cuando llueve no se seca el barro, no se puede trabajar, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de que todo el pueblo trabaja en la alfarería, las ganancia las vuelve a invertir, para sobrevivir, para comer, para pagar el préstamo, ella está planeando surtir mas de material su negocio para tener almacenado y seguir trabajando junto con su mama y su hermano que también ellos le ayudan a pagar el préstamo, este negocio ha ayudado mucho a la familia a la alimentación a vivir mejor,  las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son repellar su casa, sus planes y esperanzas para el futuro son seguir trabajando y que estén bien de salud, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo que le dan porque va a tener dinero para comprar el material. San Bartolo Cohuecan es un pueblo tranquilo, se ve el volcán Popocatepet e Iztaccihuatc en el mes de diciembre el volcán Popocatepet se ve rojo, siembran de temporal sorgo, maíz, cacahuate y cebolla, el 24 de Agosto celebran al santo patrono San Bartolo, dura 8 días la fiesta, le dan de comer a todo la gente del pueblo y visitantes, hay música, toritos, juegos pirotécnicos, hay promesas, danzas aztecas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad, “muchas gracias por estos préstamos que nos dan y ojala nos presten con menos interés porque esta dura la situación y que no aumenten el interés para que nos alcance mas para los materiales”
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Virgen de Juquila' and is located in San Miguel Cohuecan neighborhood, in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  It is made up of 7 hard-working women who know each other and are neighbors.  They are Ernestina R. Ramírez, who will use her loan to buy clay and white clay to make pitchers that she sells unfired; Petra Constantina V. M., who will buy clay to make pitchers; Luisa S. González, who will buy firewood, clay and white clay for making pots and casserole dishes; Maura A. V., who will buy clay to make rustic pitchers; Diana Martínez López, who will buy medicines, anti-inflamatories, syrups and analgesics to stock her pharmacy; Manuela S. S., who will buy clay and firewood to make pedestals and Gabina R. A., who will buy clay and white clay to make casserole dishes.

Luisa S. González is a member of the group.  She is 36 years old and studied up to the 6th year of elementary school, obtaining her leaver's certificate.  She is single and lives with her mom and brother.  They work as potters, making pitchers, casserole dishes and pots.  Luisa is requesting her loan to buy firewood, clay and white clay to stock her business with supplies so that she has the material she needs to make her pitchers, casserole dishes and pots.  She started in her business 28 years ago, watching how her mom cut the clay, and she learned all on her own.  It is a family business and all her family work in it.  It is located in her home and is very important because she supports herself with it.

Luisa enjoys being a potter, making casserole dishes and painting them.  She is proud because she works, bakes her products and everything comes out beautifully.  It has also helped her to take a stewardship role in her community.  There are 8 days of fiesta each year when they feed everybody and provide the church with floral arrangements and candles.  Luisa's customers are from Jaloxtoc, Ahuatlan and Tepetlixpa.  Her business is popular because of the good work that she does and the finishing touches that she makes to the pitchers, casserole dishes and pots.  The challenge that she faces in her business is the climate.  When it rains, the clay doesn't dry and she can't work.  Her business also faces competition because the whole village makes pottery items.  Luisa re-invests the profits that she makes back into her business, uses some to survive on, some to eat and some to repay her loan.  She is planning to stock her business with more material so that she can have some stored up.  She plans to continue working together with her mom and brother who will also help her to repay the loan.  This business has helped her family a lot.  It has provided them with the food they need and helped them to live more comfortably.

The improvement that Luisa would like to make to her home is to plaster it.  Her plans and hopes for the future are to continue working and for everyone to enjoy good health.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan because she will have money to buy the material she needs.

San Bartolo Cohuecan is a quiet village.  From it you can see the Popocatapetl and Iztaccihuatl volcanoes.  In the month of December, the Popocatapetl volcano turns red and they sow sorghum, corn, peanuts and onions.  Starting August 24th, they celebrate an 8-day-long fiesta dedicated to the patron saint San Bartolo (Saint Bartholomew).  They provide everybody in the village, and visitors, with food, there is music, bullfighting, fireworks, engagements and Aztec dances. 

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Many thanks for these loans that you give us.  We hope that you will lend to us at lower interest rates because the situation is difficult and let's hope the interest rates don't go up so that we have more money for our materials".

loans.use: To buy firewood, clay, white clay for making pitchers, pans and casserole dishes

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento NUEVO AMANECER esta conformado por 10 integrantes D. los cuales 7 son mujeres y 2 varones, La Sra. Esperanza  tiene dos hijos  el padre D. sus hijos le pasa  una pequeña pensión que apenas le alcanza para la alimentación, por este motivo la Sra. Tiene que salir a trabajar, ella,  se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y los fines D. semana se dedica a la venta D. comida   es muy trabajadora y su incentivo para seguir adelante son sus dos hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería D. los productos que se encuentran en promoción y así tener variedad D. productos para poD. ofrecer a sus clientes, este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por amigos  D. la zona  que  tienen una amistad D. hace varios años, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan todos los días conocidos con su respectiva actividad . es un banco muy organizado y  dinámico, todos los integrantes del banco están agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) consists of ten members, seven women and two men. Sra. Esperanza has two children. The father of her children earns a small pension that is barely enough to buy food. For this reason, Sra. Esperanza decided to go to work. She sells cosmetics and then serves food on the weekends. Esperanza is a hard worker and her two children are her incentive to move forward. The money from this loan will be used to buy merchandise that is on sale so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers.

This Communal Bank was formed by a group of local friends who have known each other for several years. Each one has an independent business. They are known each day for their respective activities. This Communal Bank is organized and dynamic. All of its members are grateful to Emprender for its support.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics in quantity

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roger; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de instrumentos musicales como guitarras, quenas, flautas, charangos entre otros el lleva años en este negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, él socio a la vez trabaja en una imprenta de lunes a sábado, él socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para así tener más variedad de instrumentos musicales que ofrecer a sus clientes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Roger is a member of the community bank Sacsayhuaman, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  

Roger is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  He balances his daily activities with a business selling musical instruments like guitars, guenas, flutes, charangos, and others.  He has had this business for years with his wife.  He also works as a printer from Monday to Saturday.  Roger is a happy person who wants his family to succeed.

He is asking for this loan to purchase more merchandise so that he can have a larger variety of musical instruments to offer his customers.

He is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments.

loans.name: Mendee

texts.en:
Mendee, 44,  is married and lives with his wife and son in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. His wife helps him with the business and his son attends a local secondary school.

 Mendee began retail trading of clothes in 2009. He started his business with a working capital of 600,000 MNT and his current working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. His business is family-based as his wife helps him with the sales. They want to expand their business and increase their revenue. 

Mendee is a hard-working and honest person. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothes from China for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from China.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with a grown son. She lives in the small town of Privetnoye, Ukraine. Valentina is a farmer and grows vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, cabbage, onions and beets. She first tried her luck farming twenty years ago. Currently, she has already invested about 80,000 UAH in this enterprise.

Valentina is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH. She is planning to spend 3,000 UAH on fertilizers, 3,000 UAH on seeds, 5,000 UAH on wood, 3,000 UAH on a drip irrigation unit and 1,000 UAH on polyethylene film. She is going to cultivate 20,000 tomatoes, 20,000 peppers, 50,000 cabbage heads, 100,000 onions and 5 tons of beets.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, plastic film, seeds, wood and a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Jasmina Elibeth

texts.es: Jasmina Elibeth se dedica a la venta de calzado. Tiene más de 12 años que por cuenta propia decidió iniciar con esta actividad. Jasmina tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo es por el que ella lucha todos los días. Ella sale todos los días a vender sus productos pues la mayoría de sus clientes le realizan encargos y ella se encarga ir a visitarlos para llevarles sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de sandalias, botas, chinelas, zapatos deportivos y zapatillas.
texts.en: Jasmina Elibeth makes her living selling footwear. She has been in this business working independently for over twelve years. Jasmina has a minor son who is the reason that motivates her work every day. Jasmina goes out daily to sell her products because the majority of her clients place orders that she has to deliver to their homes. She will use the loan to purchase sandals, boots, athletic shoes, and running shoes.

loans.use: to purchase footwear

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govi-Altai Province in Mongolia. Her children are all grown and live separately.

Enhtuya manages a meat and dairy product trading business with the help of her husband, a business she started in 1990. At that time her working capital was 150,000 MNT, and she sold only meat. In 2003 she began selling dairy products to supplement her earnings. She managed to improve her business and bought one more stall to increase her sales channels. She travels to the countryside of Mongolia to purchase animals for her business.

A friendly woman who says, "I want to buy a house for my younger son," Enhtuya is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an abundant amount of meat.

loans.name: Jose Denis

texts.es:
José tiene su propio negocio, iniciando con poco y con el apoyo de su familia, casado, su negocio es la venta de vasos y platos descartable, bolsas de regalo, papel de regalo, plástico por yarda, servilletas pues ha surtido con todos los productos para fiestas de cumpleaños.
Lo que atreves de las ganancias ha venido trabajando y Afodenic quien dio un financiamiento para comenzar hacer su cuarto. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en mercadería en veinte docenas de empaque para comida, veinte docenas de platos desechables cinco docenas de tenedor y cucharas desechables, entre otros productos que son de mucha demanda. Lo que cada día espera ir creciendo y cantado clientela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
José owns his own business.  He started out with limited resources and the support of his family (he is married).  His business is selling disposable cups and plates, gift bags, wrapping paper, plastic by the yard, and napkins.  He has stocked his business with a wide range of birthday party supplies.

Through the profits that he has made in his work and loans from Afodenic, he has managed to start building a room.  José will invest this new loan in merchandise.  He will buy 20 dozen food packages, 20 dozen disposable plates, 5 dozen disposable forks and spoons, and other products that are in great demand.  Every day, he hopes to continue growing and gaining customers in order to enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy disposable plates, cups and napkins in larger quantities

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelita is 43 years old and has two children who are in school. Amelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her stall. Amelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 38 years old. He has been operating a van-transport business for 10 years. He is married and blessed with three children, ages 15, 11, and 5. He hopes to own several other vans for more income generation in the future. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him in good managerial skills and how to save and handle finances. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a gearbox.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia de 56 años de edad, esta casada con Donato de 61 años y tienen 01 hijo llamado Michael de 22 años y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el sector Huarmamayo perteneciente al distrito de Quimbiri. Otilia, es una señora entusiasta y enfocada en sus responsabilidades; se dedica al negocio de un Bar – Recreo con el nombre “La Choza” ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri donde ofrece bebidas alcohólicas para el consumo de las personas mayores; igualmente ofrece platos típicos de la zona como: Tacacho con cecina, Juanes, entre otros. En su negocio cuenta con el apoyo de 03 señoritas que están dispuestas a brindar la buena comodidad a su público concurrente, viene trabajando 11 años en este negocio y esta agradecida por la preferencia de sus consumidores. Los fines de semana cuentan con mayor acogida de público, lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Otilia acude una vez más a los préstamos que la institución concede a los mas necesitados con la finalidad de crecer e invertir el dinero en una utilidad. Los planes para el futuro  de su negocio es abrir una  nueva sucursal con el mismo nombre y en el mismo distrito en mención. Este será su octavo crédito y por lo cual necesita el apoyo de ustedes para seguir progresando, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y esta agradecida por  pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado renovará sus muebles deterioradas como mesas y sillas por nuevas.
texts.en:
Otilia is 56 years old and married to 61 year-old Donato.  They have one son called Michael who is 22 years old.  They live together in their own home which is located in Huarmamayo, in Quimbiri district.

Otilia is an enthusiastic woman who is focused on her responsibilities.  She runs a bar called "La Choza" which is located in Quimbiri district.  She sells alcoholic beverages to adults.  She also sells typical regional dishes such as 'tacacho con cecina' (roasted, mashed plantains with pork), 'juanes' (a chicken dish), etc.  In her business, she has the support of three young ladies who are willing to provide her public with good customer service.  She has been in this business for 11 years and is grateful for the loyalty of her customers.  More people come to her bar on weekends and so she makes more money then.  Otilia is, once again, taking out one of the loans that the institution offers those most in need with the goal of growing her business and investing the money in it.  Her future plan for her business is to open a new branch with the same name, in the same district.

This will be Otilia's eighth loan and she needs your support in order to continue making progress.  She pledges to make her repayments on time and is grateful that she belongs to her community bank.  She will use the money she has requested to replace her worn furniture such as tables and chairs with new ones.
