loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Arciliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Arciliano está casado con la Sra. Acelina hace varios años tienen 4 hijos menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria. 
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en ciudad del Este, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
El comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio,  puesto que ya llevan un buen tiempo en este trabajo. El se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, dice que todo lo que hace es por el bien de sus hijos,  para darles un mejor futuro y una buena educación.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, jabones, y otros, con lo cual desea abastecer su negocio. El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones
texts.en:
Arciliano has been married to Acelina for several years; they have four minor children that are still in elementary school.

Together they set up a store in their home located in Ciudad Del Este.  They started out with a small amount of capital that they had saved up from previous salaried employment they’d had.

He comments that he does well with the business because they’ve been in it for some time now.  He defines himself as a very hardworking, tenacious man.  He says that everything is for his children’s wellbeing, to give them a better future and a good education.

He is asking for the loan to buy sugar, rice, soap and others to stock the store.  He has had previous loans with us and he repaid in an excellent way.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and others.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 29 years old, is selling sweets. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver (a motorbike with a cart attached). Their income is $11 per day. She has two children, 8 and 9 years old; both of them are studying at school. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a new Tok Tok to continue her husband's career because the current Tok Tok is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to get a shop for selling many kinds of cakes, and her husband wants to buy a small car to transport foreigners or tourists to visit any place in his province as this can make a good income for their family.

loans.use: to buy a new Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached) for her husband's career.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is a 27-year-old married man with two children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling shoes for four years, having acquired the initial capital from farming. His hardships are poor transport facilities and theft. His goals are to have a wholesale shop and to educate his children. Josephat needs this loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora  Gabriela, vive en una colonia muy cercana del pueblo, ella  es casada con el señor Luis Antonio  y con quien procreo tres hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella solicito  el préstamo  en el mantenimiento de  su camioneta  de transporte, en donde lleva practicando siete años   y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido  un buen resultado para su familia.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su esposo quien  es que maneja la camioneta  para atender bien a sus clientes que son los que lo motiva a seguir trabajando por que le comentan que es muy amable en dar el servicio.

    Lo  que desea es que  con su préstamo que solito pueda continuar trabajando y así tener un mejor ahorro para darle lo mejor asus hijos que son su motivo de seguir adelnate.
texts.en:
Gabriela lives in a neighborhood that’s quite near to town.  She’s married to Luis Antonio and they have three children still in their care.

She requested the loan to service her transportation van that’s she’s been operating for seven years.  She comments that she does well since she’s obtained good results for her family.

What motivated her to go into this activity was her husband who drives the van to provide good service to their customers who motivate her to continue working because they comment that he is very kind to them when providing the service.

She hopes that with the loan she requested she will be able to stay in business and have savings to provide the best for her children who are the motivation for her to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 27-year-old single business man. For the last two years he has been running a motorbike transport business. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next five years he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es:
Doña Luisa, cuenta con su propio negocio, un comedor desde hace veintidos años, el cual ha venido creciendo, al trabajar con dedicacion en su negocio para el apoyo economico de su familia, su esposo se desempeña en administracion de empresa, el cual ha apoyado con el dinero de su labor.
Es madre de tres hijos, uno casado y dos estudiante de la universidad, doña luisa, ha sido muy trabajadora, comenzo con la venta de fritanga , lo que con los años, puso su comedor con las ganancias y luego con financiamiento en Afodenic, logro ampliar a comedor, su especialidad en comida es el pollo asado al horno, pues se ha hecho gustar muchos por los clientes.
Con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de docientas cincuenta libra de pollo entero, docientas cincuenta libra de carne de res y cerdo. Siendo los platos que mas se venden., al comprar al mayor, le rebajan y da a precios accesibles su comida, es por eso cada dia sus ventas han crecido. El cual esta sastifecha.
texts.en:
Luisa has had her own business for the last 22 years; it’s an eatery that’s been growing thanks to the dedication she puts into her work to provide economically for her family.  Her husband works managing a firm and he contributes the money he earns with his labor.

She is the mother of three children. One’s married and two go to university.  Luisa has been very hardworking.  She started out selling fried fast food.  In time, she was able to open her dining room with the profits and then with loans from Afodenic was able to expand the dining room.  Her specialty is roasted chicken that has become very popular with her customers.

She will use this new loan to buy 250 pounds of whole chicken and 250 pounds of beef and pork since these are the dishes that sell the most.  Prices are reduced when she buys wholesale and she can then sell her dishes at affordable prices; this is why her sales have increased daily and this makes her satisfied.

loans.use: to buy chicken and meat.

loans.name: Ereneo

texts.en:
Ereneo is 50 years old and is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jocelyn, who is a housewife and mother to their children. Ereneo, together with his wife, manages his household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ereneo operates a van rental business. He has one van that may be rented for transportation service or for people who need a van for out-of-town service. Ereneo provides his services within the city and nearby provinces. He also sells ready-to-wear products to earn additional income. Ereno’s regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  He earns a weekly minimum of 4,000 PHP in sales every week.

Ereneo is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain his van to help him continue to operate his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands. In the future, Ereneo hopes to buy another van and support his children’s education through college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share weekly stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from his studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain his van

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and married to Paul who is employed. They are blessed with one child who is five years old. She has been in a farming activity for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ruth will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into dairy keeping. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la Asociación  Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco. Mercedes sigue con la tienda D. lavandería y tintorería y le está yendo muy bien. 

Mercedes con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Mercedes requiere el préstamo para comprar por ejemplo detergentes, tintes, perfumes y otras cosas más.
 
Mercedes se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mercedes continues to participate in the “Inti Pakareq” communal bank which is a part of the Arariwa Association's microfinance unit in the city of Cusco. Mercedes still has her laundry and dry-cleaning business and it is going very well. 

She did very well with the previous loan and she was able to obtain many benefits. For this reason, she wants to request another loan because it will help her a lot.

Mercedes needs the loan in order to purchase detergents, dyes, perfumes and other items. 

She is grateful for this opportunity that has been provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase detergent, dyes, perfumes and other items.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of her children go to school.  She has two additional family members. 

Prossy sells fast foods in a restaurant on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 15 years.  She also teaches at a primary school where she gets her other source of income.  She works seven days a week. 

Prossy has requested a loan of 600000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, beef and sausages. Her major business challenges are: the ever increasing prices of foodstuff in Uganda, the holidays because many of her customers are university students, transportation, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully-stocked a restaurant so as to serve more customers. 

Prossy lives in a rented house and her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees and rent

loans.use: buy potatoes, beef and sausages

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is single and has been selling ladies’ accessories around Mombasa for four years.

Elias is applying for a loan of KES 40,000 in order to purchase more ladies’ jewelry, bags, and clothes. He learned about Milango Financial Services through a promotion and is committed to acquire and repay loans through Milango.

Since Elias does not own a stall, he has to forgo selling when it rains. He looks forward to doing business even more energetically and to earning more income in order to establish a stall. This will also enable him support his extended family, which depends on him.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies’ jewelry, bags, and clothes.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is 32 years old and single.  For four years, she has been tailoring to earn a living.  She has employed two people to assist her in the business.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented because she has been trained in business management and she has gained more business ideas from her group members.

Truphena hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Mary Nohemy

texts.es:
Mary Nohemí, tiene 32 años de edad, casada desde hace 16 años, tiene 4 hijos de 9, 11, 14 y  16 años de edad, vive en Cofradia, Cortes. Su esposo se dedica a la Mecánica Automotriz.
 Mary es una persona muy activa, trabajadora, realiza dos actividades de negocio, compra Maíz en mazorca, luego lo desgrana a mano y lo vende por libras, arroba o quintal a los vecinos de la comunidad, igual que los frijoles, los compra recién cortados y los desgrana, los seca y los vende  ya limpios. Ella lo compra a un precio, lo vende a otro precio y obtiene buenas ganancias. También vende mercadería como  ropa, cremas, lociones, todo lo que le pidan los clientes, su venta es entrega según el pedido.
Este es el noveno préstamo que ha solicitado a ODEF, y los ha pagado muy bien, con este préstamo actual va comprar maíz y frijoles y con otra parte va comprar mercadería para cubrir los pedidos que le han hecho los clientes.
Se siente muy bien con su negocio, ha incrementado clientes y las ventas.
texts.en:
Mary Nohemí, 32, has been married for 16 years.  She has four children who are 9, 11, 14 and 16 years of age.   She lives in Cofradía, Cortes.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Mary is a very active, hardworking person.  She has two businesses.  She buys corn on the cob that she hulls by hand and then sells the corn by the pound, arroba or quintal to neighbors in her community.  She also sells beans that she buys freshly harvested and she removes the husks, dries them and sells them already cleaned.  She buys them at one price and sells them at another obtaining good profits.  She also sells merchandise like clothes, creams and lotions, everything her customers ask for.  She sells based on prior orders.

This is the 9th loan she’s asked ODEF for and she has repaid them very well.  She will use the present loan to buy corn and beans and another part of it to buy merchandise to fill orders placed by customers.  She feels very good with her business; its client base and sales have increased.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old and single. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a principled man. 

He has been selling water in a busy place for the last one year. His business is faced with a problem of low purchasing power from the customers. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more containers for water storage. Stephen's hopes and dreams are to have a permanent place for selling water in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more water containers for water storage.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is motorcycle transportation, which he has been operating for the last four years. He started riding other people's motorcycles while he saved money and bought his own motorcycle. His challenge is price fluctuation and inflation. His dream is buying more motorcycles and building a permanent home. John needs the loan to buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 30 years old.  He is married to Jacinta and they have been blessed with one child who is one year old.  He supports his family of three members by running a retail shop.  He has been in business for one year and, at the moment, his monthly income from the business is 15,000 KES.

A friend introduced Pius to KADET LTD.  He is borrowing his first loan in the amount of 20,000 KES.  With it, he intends to purchase 100 kilograms of sugar to sell.

loans.use: to increase his inventory by purchasing sugar to sell.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yunana and Abba.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isiyaku  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador de 39 años, goza de su gran familia conformada por sus 4 hijos y su pareja Eva, ambos siempre se han apoyado para salir adelante por sus hijos. Juan se dedica a la agricultura principalmente el cultivo de maíz, siempre se ha preocupado por el medio ambiente, es por ello que realiza practicas amigables con el medio ambiente. Juan solicita el préstamo para incursionar en la ganadería; comprara ganado vacuno, Juan espera producir carne orgánica, alimentando a su ganado con forraje de calidad. Juan espera tener como ventaja una comercialización a un más alto costo que la carne producida bajo un método de producción tradicional.

loans.use: Para compra de ganado vacuno

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is 63 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn for living she plants and harvest vegetable and has corn fields to monitor, She plant vegetables and sell them to the community. She wants to increase her income that's why she decided to borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden and corn fileds, so that it can produce a good quality of vegetables and able to have a lot of vegetables to be sell in the market. Estela plan for the future to expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married with 5 children, 2 in secondary school. He has received some basic training in entrepreneurship from World Vision. He started his motorbike transportation business 2 years ago after raising some funds from tobacco sales. He now wishes to buy a second motorbike. He has been able to raise some funds from the business toward the purchase, and the loan of US$450 from PEMCI is to make up for the shortfall. With the two motorbikes operational he will be able to repay the loan without fail. Motorbike transportation (known as Boda Boda) is emerging as a quicker alternative to bicycle transportation. The motorbikes are used to ferry passengers long distances that the bicycles cannot reach. This emerging alternative will have a very positive impact on the economy and the communities in the area.

loans.use: To Purchase A Motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.en:
Mrs Ramirez has a semi-fixed business where she has sold "curiosities," in the center of the city for 13 years. "Both my husband and myself work in the business, it is our means of family income. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 dollars in order to have a greater variety of products in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. R. cuenta con un negocio semifijo de curiosidades en el centro de la ciudad desde hace 13 años. “Entre mi esposo y yo trabajamos en el negocio es nuestra fuente de ingreso familiar". Solicito un préstamo de $ 1.200.00 dlls. Para tener variedad de mercancía en el negocio.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S., a 38-year-old business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, has overcome the limitation of her illiteracy by operating a meal preparation business. Left single after a previous marriage, Rosemarie supports herself by providing cooked meals -- often comprised of plantains, rice, and locally grown vegetables -- to her community. Her business is adjacent to the main bridge entering town, a prime location in Trou-du-Nord for a business such as hers. Rosemarie will use this first loan to expand her inventory of food and supplies to better meet the needs of her community.

Note: Rosemarie is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of supplies and food.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child. They live in the village of Barghlyeh in south Lebanon. She offers housekeeping services but earns a limited monthly income. This is the first time Abir requests a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs USD 300 to do some sanitary improvement and maintenance work at home before the winter starts.

Abir is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "A. Ata", meaning,"the sharing". A group is usually made up of female volunteers living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending system is based on incrementA. increases in loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment.

The strength of the group loan is that it encourages a collaborative approach in the borrowing community as the group has to work together to ensure that every loan is paid off. It is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women in Lebanon.

loans.use: Do some maintenance work in her home before the winter season starts

loans.name: Salawu

texts.en: Salawu A. is 34 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a tradeswoman, and they live with their children in Yopougon, in the north of Abidjan. Salawu has a mill in Adjame, where he processes various cereals and dry fruit to produce and sell different types of food powder. Salawu and his wife have been able to send their 3 elder children to school. Salawu is dynamic and well organized. He manages his business very well. He benefited from his first loan from AE&I in 2005, using the money to buy machinery parts for his mill. He has since then received more loans that he has successfully repaid. He is now asking for a loan of US$825, which will be used to purchase cereal and dry fruit for processing.

loans.use: Purchase of cereal and dry fruit

loans.name: Thi Vinh

texts.vi:
Ms. Vinh is 45 years old. She is living with her family in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is a very dynamic woman. At first, her family overcame the difficulties and earned some money for her children to go to school by working for other stores. They saved money and opened an Internet cafe. Currently, their income is from the Internet cafe. Through the fund, she would like to borrow money to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vinh đã 45 tuổi, chị sống cùng gia đình tại phố Chờ, Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Chị là một người phụ nữ rất năng động. ban đầu, gia đình chi cũng vất vả khó khăn mới kiếm được ít tiền nuôi con ăn học bằng cách làm thuê cho các cửa hàng. Về sau, hai anh chị cũng dành dụm và đã mở được một quán Internet. Bây giờ, anh chị có nguồn thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh internet. Qua chương trình, chị muốn vay một khoản tiền để mở rộng cửa hàng.

loans.use: Expand her Internet cafe

loans.name: Airina Fenias

texts.pt:
Airina Fenias C. is a married mother of 6 children, currently living in Boane, and was born on 1/1/1955. She is a farmer who started with FDM in January 2004 and took out 1800 meticais in the Paulina group. Now, she would like to take out the amount of 8000 meticais as an individual loan, to be paid in 4 months. She is in her 12th loan cycle. She sells products from the farm.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Airina Fenias C., nascida a 01/01/1955, casada mãe de 6 filhos residente em Boane, é agricultora entrou no FDM em janeiro de 2004 tomou 1800 no grupo Paulina agora ja toma sozinha vai tomar o valor de 8000 para pagar em 4 meses esta no 12º ciclo vende Produto da Machamba .

loans.use: Investing in agriculture

loans.name: Tukae

texts.en:
Tukae is 18 years old and is single with one child. Tukae sells chicken meat, a business she started in 2007. She works from 7 am to 1 pm every day at her business.

In the past, Tukae has taken out successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 28 years old and is single with two children, ages 10 and 7. Amina sells cloth, a business she started in 2005. She works every day from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. earns a monthly profit of about $140.

Amina is applying for a loan of $150 to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Luz G. G. is a partener of the "Alfonso Ugarte" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, San Martin Province, Tarapoto District. She is dedicated to the elaboration and sales of all kinds of handicrafts that are used in different environments around the house, business or office. Since she was little, Mrs. G. developed abilities to make all kinds of handicrafts. When she separated from her husband , she saw herself in need of supporting her daughters and herself. She decided to formally dedicate herself to this activity.

Today she is studying Education For Work (food and handicrafts production) at the Pedagogical Superior Institute of Tarapoto. She has strenghtened her creativity and experience. With the 3,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan that she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy: colored threads, different types of fabrics like: canvas for embriodery, felp, and other fabrics in varied colors and designs and rails, all of this materials to make curtains, tableclothes, sheets, bedspreads, table covers, napkins, cushions, and stuff animals to satisfy her demanding clientele and to offer good service.

Mrs. G. is 39 years old and has 2 daughters who are students. They are her stimulus to continue working and to improve herself every day. With her entreprenurial vision, she plans to have a well-established handicrafts' shop and other related products.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Luz G. G., es socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte ” vive en la Región San Martín ,Provincia de San Martín , distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de todo tipo de manualidades para ser utilizados en los diferentes ambientes del hogar, negocio u oficina. Desde muy pequeña desarrollo habilidades manuales, al separarse de su esposo en la necesidada de sacarle a delante a sus hijas decidió dedicarse formalmente a esta actividad. En la actualidad esta estudiando en el Instituto Superior Pedagógico de Tarapoto la carrera de Educación para el trabajo (producción alimenticia y artesanal) en la que esta fortaleciendo su creatividad y experiencia. Con el préstamo de S/.3000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses comprará: hilos de colores, telas de diferentes tipos como: cañamazo, felpa, diolen. tapasol, pelón, en variados diseños y colores, rieles, todo esto para la confección de cortinas, manteles, sabanas, cubrecamas, tapetes, servilletas, cojines, peluches para satisfacer a su exigente clientela un buen servicio. Tiene 39 años de edad y 2 hijas estudiantes, quienes son el estimulo para seguir trabajando y superándose cada vez mas, con visión empresarial piensa instalar un taller bien implementado de manualidades y otros productos Afines.

loans.use: Buying more supplies for making her products.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto E. C. runs a hardware shop from his home in the municipality of Cinco Pinos. Roberto is married and takes care of his wife and children, watching out so that they don't lack anything in the home. From the time he started his business, he has gone through difficult financial times, but thanks to the support from Ceprodel, he has been able to continue growing his business and stocking more products to sell. It's important to note that he has repaid the loans he's received on time and is well established within the institution.

El caballero Roberto E. C. se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de productos ferreteros y artesanales vendiendolos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Cinco Pinos donde posee su propio establecimiento.

Es casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su esposa e hijos velando para que no les falte nada en el hogar. Desde que inició en el negocio ha atravesado por circunstancias económicas difíciles pero gracias al apoyo que le he brindado Ceprodel, ha logrado salir adelante en la adquisición de los productos ferreteros y artesanales para su venta. Es necesario destacar que todos los créditos que he realizado los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo que se ha establecido en la institución.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HIS GROWING HARDWARE BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT HIS FAMILY.

loans.name: Sokong

texts.en: Mrs. Sokong S. is 22 years old. She lives in Wat Kdey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Saody Keo, are currently subsistence farmers. They have one child who is too young to work or enroll in school. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokong S. would like to start a grocery business. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase grocery goods to sell in the local market. Her husband and her child are also shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru:
M. Huseyn lives in Khuroson region. He is 52, married and has 4 children. He finished high school. Currently, Huseyn trades farm animals. He purchases young animals, feeds them, and then resells them later. This business brings profits. Therefore, to develop it further, Huseyn needs additional money. He would like to receive a loan. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Хусей житель района Хуросон. 52 года , женат и имеет 4 детей.. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота. Скупает молодняк , откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Это бизнес приносит доход , поэтому для того , чтобы его развивать нужны вложения. Сейчас Хусейн хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет он в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is separated, 36 years old and has two children. Felipa buys used car tires that she uses to make ojotas (sandals) that are worn by the local campesinos. She works in the city of Lima in a rented locale and has people to help her. Sometimes the tires in good condition are retreaded in order to sell them later to be reused. Also, Felipa sells clothing that she buys in the city of Lima.

Felipa needs a loan for 1,750 soles – money that will be used to purchase more second-hand tires.

She dreams of having her own home in Lima, helping her children get ahead so they can be professionals and having a store to sell footwear materials.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Felipa es separada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Felipa compra neumáticos usados de carros con los cuales fabrica ojotas (sandalias elaboradas de neumáticos usados de carro) que son utilizadas por los campesinos de la zona, actividad que realiza en la ciudad de Lima en un local alquilado para lo cual cuenta con operadores, en algunas oportunidades los neumáticos en buenas condiciones los hace reencauchar para luego comercializarlos como neumáticos de segunda. Además Felipa vende ropa que compra en la ciudad de Lima.

Felipa necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de un lote de llantas de segunda.

Felipa sueña con tener casa propia en la ciudad de Lima, Ayacucho, sacar adelante a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener una tienda de materiales de calzado.

loans.use: Purchase used tires to make sandals

loans.name: Silvia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Soledad, tiene 48 años, es divorciada, estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando porque se casó, después estudió cosmetología, artesanía, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Distrito D. El Porvenir en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.
La empresaria trabaja en artesanía en hilos y cueros, empezó como distracción, también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, D. ropa, trabaja por campañas. La socia tiene 02 años trabajando en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su hermana la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA” ella decidió participar en este Banco porque siempre se le cerraban las puertas para adquirir el préstamo  en otra entidad, porque tenía que tener la garantía D. su esposo (AVAL), era un reto, porque siendo capaz, podía desenvolverse  además  salir adelante sin el apoyo D. otra persona y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró hilos, agujas, palillos, agujas D. tejer.
Con el préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. plantas PVC, docenas D. polos.
La socia sueña con seguir trabajando, porque es un estimulo como mujer ser independiente.
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece, tiene el cargo D. tesorera, cuya función es llevar la contabilidad y ver que todo esté conforme.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Soledad is 48 years old, divorced, and has completed her secondary education. She did not continue her studies because she got married, but she later studied cosmetology and folk art. She has 3 children and lives in the El Provenir district in Trujillo Province in the La Liberdad department. This businesswoman works in folk art, both needlework and leather, which she began as a hobby. She also sells cosmetics and clothing, and works for campaigns. She has been a working member of the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her sister recommended her to the communal bank ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA (Hope for Tomorrow). She decided to participate in this bank because the doors were always closed to getting a loan elsewhere because she needed her husband, Aval, as a guarantor. This was a challenge, because being a capable person, she was able to cope and even get ahead without anybody else's help. With the first loan of $1000 that she received, she bought threads, needles, knitting needles, and weaving needles. With this loan of $425, which she will repay in 4 months, she intends to invest in artificial plants and dozens of poles. This member dreams of continuing to work, because it is stimulating to be an independent woman. She is the treasurer of the communal bank that she belongs to, whose function is to do the bookkeeping and see that everything is proper.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of artificial plants and poles.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fedrick A. is 30 years old and is married with one child, who is currently studying in school.  As a food vendor, Fredrick sells fried rice with a special maggi sauce, chopped vegetables, and shredded meat.  Although most of his business is done in the evening, Fredrick enjoys great success because fried rice is something every tribe in Ghana enjoys.  In order to increase the amount of fried rice he can cook and sell each day, Fredrick wants to purchase greater quantities of rice, vegetable oil, vegetables, and meat.  He has subsequently joined the Diligence Hands Trust Group, which allows members to guarantee loans for one another, and is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase more ingredients for fried rice.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetable oil, vegetables, and meat for making fried rice.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra N. est détentrice d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Womé, un village situé à environ 10 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 39 ans, Abra est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des cartons de savons, de boîtes de conserves, des sacs de riz et autres marchandises. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients et de gagner plus d’argent pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra N'kutia is the owner of a general goods store in Womé, a village located about 10 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Abra is 39 years old, married and the mother of two (2) children. She is hoping to increase the size of her business by buying cartons of soap, boxes of preserves, sacks of rice and other merchandise. This would allow her to meet the needs of her customers and earn more money to improve the conditions of her family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Shirkhan

texts.en:
Shirkhan Q. is a good father and a hard-working farmer who is steadfast in his endeavor of raising animals. Shirkhan sells dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt, in addition to selling calves for meat production. He started his business in 2000 and it has been the main source of income for his family ever since. His family consists of his wife, one son, and his old parents. Thanks to his wife’s assistance, he is able to raise and feed the animals and prepare them for sale at the marketplaces in a nearby town.

In addition to raising animals, Shirkah has a car and sometimes takes local people to the downtown area for a price, but this job is not constant, so he is focused more on developing his livestock business. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase two calves and one milking cow. He promises to be responsible and prompt in repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchase two calves and one milking cow

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man N. lives in Sambuor Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns 0.6 hectar on which she makes a living cultivating rice. She would like to grow a crop in the dry season, and has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds to cultivate. She will also use a portion of this loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to make her crop larger. Mrs. Man N. is a 57-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a fisherman while the other helps her on her plantation.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final” que se encuentra ubicado en el Jr. Iquitos 572 del distrito de Calleria departamento de Ucayali ,  tiene 75 años con 8 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad, es  viuda, con 8 años de socia en Manuela Ramos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, se puso a vender Juanes y tacachos, en el patio de su casa y también  incremento su  bodega.

Ahora con el ultimo préstamo de s/. 1700.00 Nuevos Soles compro gaseosas, cervezas, golosinas, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 de azúcar, 3 paquetes de aceite, 5 cajas de gaseosa.

Agradece enormemente a Dios y a Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, y que todavía tiene fuerzas por seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa , a 75-year-old widow who has eight grown children, has been a member of the Community Bank named “Together To The End” for eight years. With an earlier loan of approximately $100 USD, she enlarged her small shop and began selling “tachachos” and “juanes” (delicious regional dishes) on her home patio. With this current loan of approximately $550 USD, Rosa will buy soft drinks, beer, sweets, two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, three jugs of oil and five flats of soda. Rosa is extremely grateful to God and to the Manuela Ramos organization for having the confidence in her to have the strength to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer, sweets, two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, three jugs of oil and five flats of soda.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn R. is a rice grower. She is 40 years old and has five children. Her life is connected to the soil that she has tilled for many years. Her parents are farmers and they taught her everything about growing rice. Now that she has a family, she would like to increase the profitability of their rice farm.  

She started her business using their 5,059 square metre lot. For many years she has been able to maintain and grow the business. The harvest goes to the family and the remainder is sold to some rice traders in the area to earn additional income. Because of her farm, she has been able to send all her children to school and buy motorcycles for them.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI for her business expansion. She will use the loan to buy Urea fertilizer and other herbicides for her rice farm. In this way, she believes, she will have a bigger harvest. 

CEVI helps Arlyn increase her business. By joining the CEVI program, she is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Samun

texts.en:
Mr. Samun M., 46, and his wife, Mrs. Sina Sao, 36, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom are in school.

Samun has been a mason for 15 years, a skill he learned from his brother. His wife stays at home taking care of their children. The house where Samun’s family lives is in need of repair, making it difficult for them to live in it. He is therefore requesting his first loan of $1,200 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Linda Rosa

texts.es: la Sra. Linda Rosa G. tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta con ella porque ya se casaron y viven con su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, hamacas, pantalones y quesillo, ella tiene 40 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, ella vive en la aldea de jicaro galan y es reconocida como una persona muy luchadora, ella necesita el credito porque tiene que comprar las hamacas al por mayor ya que le salen muy caras comprarlas por cantidades pequeñas, y ella tiene que viajar para ir a comprarlas entoces no puede estar viajando a cada rato y comprando el producto caro, por tal razon necesita el credito.
texts.en:
Linda Rosa G. is 50 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are married and live with their spouses. She sells pork, hammocks, pants and flan. She has spent 40 years doing this type of work. She lives in the village of Jicaro Galan and is known as a fighter. She needs the loan to purchase wholesale hammocks, as it is very expensive to buy them in small quantities. Also, she must travel to buy them, and she cannot travel all the time to buy the expensive products, so this is why she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hammocks, pork, pants and flan

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia GLORIA; nació en la provincia de Urubamba, en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, tierra fértil y acogedora, está situada a 1 y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes en la esquina de su casa, alternando de esta manera el cuidado de sus hijos y la administración de su negocio, ella solicita el préstamo para implementar con mas productos su tienda abarrotes.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in Urubamba province, right in center of a valley that was sacred to the Incas because of its fertile, productive soil. The area is about 1 hour and 20 minutes away from Cusco city. Gloria alternates between taking care of her home and her business. She runs a small grocery store out of her house so that she can take care of her children and attend her shop at the same time. She is asking for a loan so that she can increase the number of products she sells from her grocery store. Gloria is grateful for the valuable help this loan will provide and is very committed to paying off the debt punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Benigna

texts.es: La señora María Y. tiene 34 años de edad, es Casada de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto con sus hijos , ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Zaculeu, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Y. is 34 years old and is married. She is by trade a weaver, "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with three looms and lives together with her suns. She and her husband both work in the same trade and also have two employees in the same activity. Maria has spent eight years making skirts in her home, which is located in the hamlet of Zaculeu in the Vásquez neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Now, the demand from her customers has increased, but because of the current economic conditions they aren't able at present to increase their capital. It's for this reason that she approached ASDIR association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and so be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerical (Increase capital)

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
S. Julienne est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au sud du Bénin. Julienne est mariée et mère de cinq enfants tous majeurs. C’est depuis son enfance que Julienne mène avec sa mère l'activité de vente de galette d’arachide. Mais Julienne s’est installée à son propre compte après son mariage dans la même activité. C’est dans les villages  environnants de Cotonou que  Julienne voyage pour acheter les galettes d’arachide. Julienne a bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé pour augmenter le volume de son activité. Vue l’importance de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroître, Julienne sollicite son cinquième crédit pour renforcer son capital. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
S. Julienne was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of five children, all of age. Since her childhood, she has, along with her mother, been selling peanut galettes. After her marriage, Julienne got situated in the same work and on her own. She travels through the villages surrounding Cotonou to buy peanut galettes. She has benefited from four ALIDÉ loans for increasing her business volume. Given the importance of her ever-growing customer base, she's requesting her fifth loan to bolster her capital. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 baskets peanut galettes

loans.name: Ghazal Group

texts.en:
The group name is Ghazal; it is made of four ladies who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

-Somaa is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. She has owned livestock for twenty-five years, producing milk. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock and her milk production. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Somaa is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she learned it when she was young. She decided on doing her business because it is in demand in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock. 

-Ayda is a 27-year-old married woman with a child. She has been working in agriculture for seven years owning livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Ayda is special in her work because she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Asria is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She works in agriculture owning livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Asria is special in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. She decided on doing her business because she likes animals. In the future, she plans on improving her work. 

-Fwaziah is a 38-year-old woman who has four children. She works in agriculture owning livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

Fwaziah is special in her work because of her experience, since she started when she was young. Her clients can be anybody from her region. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

loans.use: To increase their livestock

loans.name: Madina Nalwoga‘S Group

texts.en:
Madina is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 43 years old and married with two children aged 16 and 22 who both go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Madina resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells cereals in Owino Market and doesn’t incur any transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of thirty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years.

Madina has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more maize, beans, groundnuts (peanuts) and sorghum. Madina hopes to see her business grow bigger and to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans, groundnuts and sorghum

loans.name: Mairamchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Майрамчон - молодая женщина 28 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Майрамчон вместе с мужем занимается производством и продажей национальных колыбелек. Муж Майрамчон мастерит колыбельки, а Майрамчон продает их на рынках Джума и Якшанбе города Худжанда. Товар ей отвозит муж. Майрамчон и её муж хотят закупить сырьё для производства колыбелек. Они хотят закупить в основном доски. Майрамчон очень надеется на поддержку нашей организации для расширения ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mairamchon is a young 28-year-old woman. She is married and is mother of 3 children. Mairamchon and her husband are involved in manufacturing and selling traditional cradles. Mairamchon’s husband makes the cradles, and Mairamchon sells them at the Djuma and Yakshanbe markets in the city of Khujand. Her husband delivers the goods for her. Mairamchon and her husband want to purchase raw materials for making cradles. They want to primarily buy wood planks. Mairamchon hopes that our organization can support her in expanding her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making cradles

loans.name: Rosa Martha

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Martha vive en su casa cuenta on la compañía de su hijo y la familia de el, ya que ella es viuda y son una familia muy unida. Su hijo Mario Arturo labora en Comisión Federal de la Electricidad y contribuye para el apoyo a los gastos familiares.
La señora Rosa Martha se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo tales como el Tupper Ware (refractarios), Jafra ( cosméticos ) y uno ultimo de medicina natural, teniendo ya su clientela desde hace 12 años, proyecto por el cual esta solicitando este crédito e invertir en mas mercancía para tenerla en bodega y así cuando sus clientes deseen algún producto tenerlo al instante.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Martha lives at home in the company of her son and his family. She is a widow and her family is very close. Her son Mario Arturo works for the Federal Electricity Commission and contributes toward the family expenses.

Sra. Rosa Martha sells products through catalogs such as TupperWare (heat resistant kitchenware), Jafra (cosmetics), and the latest natural medicines. She has maintained her customer base for 12 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise she can keep in storage and have available so that her customers can receive them instantly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory for her business

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El Y. is forty-nine years old and a widow with four children. She lives with her children in Takeo Province. To make a living, she manufactures pillows, jars, and tubes made from cement which are used for construction building, typically earning $13 a day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who currently has his own business as a driver of his own car to provide transportation services for workers in the garment factory.

In order to meet growing market demand, El plans to expand her business and increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase tools to manufacture more products for her customers. She hopes she will be able to raise her family's standard of living and that she can encourage her children to seek further education at the university.

loans.use: tools for manufacturing cement tubes and jars

loans.name: Rustom

texts.en:
Rustom B. is commonly called “Tom” by his neighbors. He finished a vocational course and now he is happily married to Ma. Dolores and they are blessed with six children. They live happily in a small village located at Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Being interested in giving their children a better future motivated Rustom and his wife to help each other to satisfy their daily basic needs.

Rustom works as a field technician at the National Road of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. His daily income is being invested in his livestock business, which is hog-raising, while his wife is engaged in vending her homemade processed foods in their public market and also to their neighbors.

Rustom is borrowing PHP 11,000 from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his hog-raising business. The amount will be of big help in enabling him to sustain his business and to improve his living conditions. He aims to improve his piggery by acquiring more piglets and the needed feed supply. He further believes that “patience is the key to success”.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 45 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, todos viven en su casa. Cuando era joven se dedicaba a la agricultura; pero al casarse, motivado por su esposa, se inclinó por  la compra y venta de frutas. Desde entonces su labor es ir a las chacras a las 6 de la mañana en busca de plátanos verdes, comprándolos por arrobas (12 kilos) y las naranjas por cientos. Mientras que su esposa, en casa, va encajonado la fruta para que los martes de la quincena de mes, los camiones transporten la carga a la ciudad de Lima. Felipe gana por cada caja entre 12  y 15 soles, ganando 3 soles, por eso trata de enviar de 300 a 400 cajas. Por tal motivo, Felipe está planeando llevar el mismo sus productos hasta Lima para comercializarlos directamente y acumular mayores ganancias. 
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, siendo un buen cliente y sobre todo muy puntual a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará su capital para la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty – nine years old. She is single and has no child. She lives in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Agnes is a trader. She trades in foot wears. She buys all kinds of foot wears from Kumasi. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Agnes has been in business for over eighteen years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy foot wears

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una persona perseverante y activa que lucha por sus ideales, vive en el caserío Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el kilometro 21 carretera de Torna vista en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali, tiene 30 años y es madre de tres hijos (menores de edad), ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, para ello cuenta con un galpón (casa para aves) para criar estas aves, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en golosinas para vender en la vereda de su casa (ambulante).
Actualemnte Maribel necesita un préstamo de 1000 que será utilizado para invertir una parte en alimento balanceado para pollos que posteriormente venderá en el mercado de su localidad y otra parte invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas)y tallarines que venderá por las noches en su casa. La meta de Maribel es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Maribel is a perseverant and active person that fights for her ideals. She lives in the Señor de los Milagros hamlet, located at kilometer 21 of the Torna highway in the district of Campo Verde in the Ucayali region. She is 30 years old and is the mother of three young children. She is involved in the raising of chickens and has a shed (or coop) to raise these birds. Maribel also has the support of her husband who is involved in agriculture.

She has been a member of the “Mi Señor de los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the purchase of candy to sell on her house’s sidewalk.

Maribel currently needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will use to invest partly in balanced feed for the chickens that used to be sold in her local market, and she will invest the other portion in the supplies to make “juanes” (rice wrapped in leaves) and noodles that she will sell at night in her house. Maribel’s goal is to have a well set up restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed and to invest in the preparation of her regional dishes

loans.name: Sreyra

texts.en:
Miss Sreyra P., age 22, is single and lives with her parents along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has four siblings. 

Sreyra was not available for a photo because she was busy with her work, so her mother appears in the photo instead.

Sreyra has a full-time job in Phnom Penh and she has to spend a lot of money for traveling costs. It’s expensive for the family, so she is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for business

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: La Sra Lola, se dedica a lo que es manicure y pedicure y diseños de uñas a domicilio o en su casa , ademas que vende productos de belleza , vive en la casa de su suegra junto con su esposo y su unica hija que ya tiene 12 años la cual esta estudiando en la escuela, la Sra Lola esta estudiando para asesora de belleza en un instituto publico para asi poder abrir mas adelante su propio salon de belleza,  Solicito el credito para hacer pedido de productos de belleza por cantidad para e este fin de año y asi entregarlo al credito a un monto mayor.
texts.en:
Senora Lola provides manicures and pedicures and nail designs in customers homes or in her home. She also sells beauty products. She lives in a house with her mother-in-law and her husband and their only daughter, who is 12 and studies in school. Senora Lola is studying to become a beauty consultant in a public school; in this way she can get ahead and have her own beauty salon. She requests this loan to order beauty products in large quantities for the end of this year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beauty products

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: A. Kaï vit depuis 15 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KUASSI Martin un pêcheur, Kaï est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Kaï vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Kaï n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Kaï vend de la nourriture (riz, haricot) et aussi du poisson fumé à son domicile. Kaï s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Kaï mène cette activité depuis environs 7 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’élever le niveau de son activité, Kaï sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kaï A. has lived 15 years in Flégnon in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is married to Martin KUASSI, a fisherman, and has two children, both attending school. Kaï lives with her husband and children, and the couple share support for the family needs. Kaï has not attended school. To meet her children's needs, Kaï sells food (rice, beans, and smoked fish) from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and has been performing this activity for the past seven years. She is a former customer of ALIDé, having already received two loans from the association, both of which were fully repaid. She now requests a third loan from ALIDé, to increase her working capital and also her level of activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish and food supplies (rice and beans)

loans.name: Martin Mutiria

texts.en:
Martin K. is married to Agnes and they have two children: Joan and Martha. He is in the business of distributing cakes and also owns a retail shop. He has been operating these businesses for six years. His business is located in a highly competitive area and he relies on the retailers who are near to his shop to supply the cakes in large quantities.

Martin was introduced to KADET by other existing clients and has no previous loan from another micro-finance institution. With the loan he has applied for, Martin intends to increase his stock of cakes to supply to newly identified markets. He anticipates that he will make a profit which he will use to pay for his children’s education and to improve the living standard of his family.

Martin hopes to have a wholesale distribution business as he believes he is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To increase his stock of cakes for redistribution

loans.name: Zuleima Esmeralda

texts.es: Zuleima Esmeralda D. de 34 años de edad, reside en Cuscatancingo, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad. Ella posee una cafeteria, la cual está ubicada frente al Centro de Gobierno de El Salvador, lugar en el cual tiene 10 años de comercializar sus productos, razón por la cual los clientes la prefieren, sobre todo, los empleados que trabajan en el lugar. Zuleima solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando materia prima para la elaboración de desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo bebidas, galletas y golosinas, entre otros productos más. Zuleima es una persona muy querida en el lugar, ya que siempre la han conocido como una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se ha esforzado por brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, los cuales dependen absolutamente de ella, ya que Zuleima es madre soltera y es la única que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por esto que para ella es de mucha importancia mantener a flote su negocio y seguir adelante junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zuleima Esmeralda D. is 34 years old. She lives in Cuscatancingo, Department of San Salvador, with her two children, ages 14 and 4. She owns a coffee shop in front of the Government Center of El Salvador. She has been selling her wares in the same place for the past 10 years. Her business is favored by her customers, and especially by people who work in the area. Zuleima has asked for a loan to buy the staples she uses to make breakfast and lunch items, as well as drinks, cookies and candy, in addition to other products. Zuleima is well liked in the area; people know her as a hard worker who has done her best to provide for her children, who are solely dependent on her. Zuleima is a single mother and the only person who provides for them. It is therefore very important to her to keep her business going and to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staples for food preparation and sweets

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is married and has three children. For the last four years, he has sold bicycles and children's toys at the local market in Stryi town. His good location, as well as the high quality of his inventory, attracts many customers. Stepan is a very hardworking and purpose-driven person. He wants to develop his business further to receive sufficient income to take good care of his growing family. Stepan is requesting a loan of 15,500 UAH to increase the variety of his goods.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his stock

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: H. Joséphine  est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à TOVO Mathieu, un pêcheur, Joséphine  est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Agbato à Cotonou et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Joséphine  n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Il y a 10 ans, Joséphine  s’est mise dans la vente de tissus et des habits pour dames et hommes.   C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Joséphine  s’approvisionne. Joséphine effectue la vente de ses produits par le système de distribution. Joséphine  a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Joséphine  sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Joséphine H. was born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Mathieu TOVO, a fisherman, Joséphine has three children who are all at school. The family lives together in the Agbato district of Cotonou and the couple cover the household expenses between them. Joséphine has never been to school. Ten years ago she started selling fabric and clothes for both women and men. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Joséphine sells her products through the distribution system. She has already had two loans from ALIDé which she repaid without incident. She is applying for another loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and clothes for women and men

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana V. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Feliciana is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Feliciana owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling curtains, bed covers, and pillow case in the local community. Feliciana has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Feliciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliciana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Feliciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vibora

texts.en:
Vibora, a 36-year-old married woman, farms for a living. She has four children with the oldest aged 20.

Vibora patiently cultivates her farm in order to grow healthy rice crops. She said that her income from the farm helps a lot in providing for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education.

Vibora joined CEVI in 2008 hoping to obtain its financial services. She said that her previous loans were really helpful in maintaining her farm.

Vibora is now requesting Php 14,000, which she will use for her farm. She will buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn provides manicure and pedicure services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and makes approximately $150 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Estrellas De Atipiri Group

texts.es:
Nora H. integrante de la Asociación Comunal  Estrellas de Atipiri, del Centro Focal  Senkata, tiene 25 años y  es soltera, ella vive  en la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente en la zona Senkata, tiene el negocio de venta de cocinas  en la zona 12 de Octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, contando con un lugar propio de venta y necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.

Las demás integrantes  de esta Asociación  tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, cosméticos, producción de aguayo (tela colorida que se utiliza para cargar bebes), atención de tienda, transportista.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Nora H., a member of the Stars of Atipri Community Association from the Senkata Center, is 25 years old and single. She lives in the city of El Alto, specifically in the Senkata area. She has a business selling kitchen products in the 12th of October neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She has her own shop and needs the loan to purchase merchandise. The other members of the this association have different businesses like clothing sales, cosmetics, making aguayo (a colored fabric used to carry babies), and a taxi driver. They are all requesting loans to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and child and is the sole income provider for his family. He has been selling different types of Arabic sweets for the past six years. He buys the sweets from Tripoli, which is famous for its delicious desserts such as “baklawa”. He sells the sweets from his car. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to purchase more sweets to sell. This will be his first loan from Ameen. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more Arabic sweets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wheat to make bread

loans.name: Simon Kamakei

texts.en:
Simon has been a farmer in Naivasha town for four years now. He does cross farming of potatoes and wheat. He is 28 years old, married to Ann Muleiyo and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and pesticides for potatoes on the farm and also to help prepare part of his farm for wheat farming.

Simon plans to buy his own farming equipment, which he will be using on his farm. This will allow him to save the money that he would use to hire equipment.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for potatoes on the farm.

loans.name: Junolito

texts.en:
Junolito R. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 37 years old. Junolito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Junolito owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members while his wife is in charge of their mini-store. Junolito has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Junolito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junolito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Junolito is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Junolito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.

loans.name: Mrs. Leab Huy Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Ba Noy village, Takeo province has eighteen people who are made up a village bank loan. All they will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Leab H. is a village bank president who is 49 years old, selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also a knitter. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil and it has a lot insect.
