So to improve production, Mrs. Leab H. is seeking for a loan to bU. fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. She is widow with a child who is studying in local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Sonata De Invierno Group

texts.es:
Evarista participa como tesorera en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, en la ALCANCIA COMUNAL SONATA D. INVIERNO, mujer emprendedora cuenta con un negocio independiente, se dedica a realizar trabajos D. tejidos con lana e hilos, elabora gorras, ponchos, conjuntos para bebes y niños, estos trabajos son exportados al extranjero por una empresa que contrata sus servicios, lleva 05 años en este trabajo. Evarista comenzó este oficio por recomendación D. una amiga quien la animó a emprender este pequeño negocio, así mismo se dedica a confeccionar carteras a macramé, que son muy reconocidas por personas e instituciones por su distinguido trabajo;  
Gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado darles una mejor educación a sus hijos, y las comodidades que se requiere, Actualmente sus gastos son afrontados conjuntamente con su esposo para pagar su deuda, está realizando arreglos en su casa para lograr tener un ingreso por alquileres y mejorar su economia. Está contenta con el crédito que ha logrado, porque asi podrà hacer realidad sus planes.
texts.en:
Evarista is the treasurer of the Sonata D. Invierno (Winter Sonata) Communal Bank in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD. She is an enterprising woman who has an independent business. She makes woven items with wool and thread. She makes hats, ponchos, and outfits for babies and children. Her work is exported to foreign countries by a business that contracts her services. She has been doing this work for five years. Evarista started this craft because a friend recommended it and motivated her to start this small business. She also makes macrame purses, which are very well-known by people and institutions for her distinguished work. Thanks to her effort she has managed to give her children a better education and the necessary comforts. Currently she and her husband tackle their expenses together in order to pay their debt. She is making arrangements in her house to be able to have an income from renters. This is to improve her finances. She is happy with the loan because this is the way she will be able to make her plans a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and thread for textiles

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy S., age 46, is the village bank president. She was selected by the group's thirteen members, located in Taen village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.     
Mrs. Sophy S. is a widow who owns 2-hectares of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. In order to support this farm, she will use the loan that she has requested from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
S. Mohammed, who is in his mid-thirties, is married with three children: one son and two daughters. He owns a food stall from which he sells homemade food, soda, milk, water and juice. He has been running this business for 15 years. The stall is open daily from 7 a.m. until midnight. His business earns him a good monthly profit.

This will be S.’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. S.’s goal with this loan is to increase his stock of beverages. He believes that the combined sales of drinks and food will increase his profits.

S. will share the loan with his loan group, Uwezesho, which has 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for the repayment of the loans.

In the picture, S. is the first on the right, in the front.

loans.use: To increase his stock of beverages

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca T. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a green vegetables farm.


Rebbeca is 46 years old and is divorced. She has five children and her children go to school.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of 4 school-age children.  She has been running a clothing and shoes store for the past eight years. She only sells women's and children's clothes. Her business income is very vital for her family because she helps her husband with the household in addition to paying school fees. She is requesting a $1200 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to expand her store’s inventory. This will be her second loan and it will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell men's clothing and shoes from her store.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Phillo Aba

texts.en: Phillo Aba E. sells clothing materials in Abura. Phillo has received senior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Phillo has been selling clothing materials for quite some time now. She is responsible for assisting her husband pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing materials for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land to build a family house in the future. The photo shows a display of the clothing materials she sells.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for sale

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rómulo de 39 años y sus 2 querido hijos Jover de 17 y Pamela de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con el único deseo de sacar adelante a su familia, Dionisia se embarca semanalmente a la región de Junín llevando fardos de ropa para vender en la ciudad de Huancayo, que son adquiridas dichas prendas en Lima, motivo por el cual son rápidamente compradas, ya que son muy bonitas y novedosas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que así puede ganarse el cariño de sus compradores, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus fardos de ciudad en ciudad, ya que esta actividad la cansa mucho. Con el tiempo, desea abrir una tienda en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que es muy solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, con lo cual implementara mejor su stock de ventas.
texts.en:
Dionisia is a jovial and hardworking 37 year old who lives in her own home with her 39 year old husband Romulo and their two children Jover (17) and Pamela (10). Their children are the driving force behind all their efforts. In hopes of seeing her family succeed, Dionisia heads weekly to the Junin region with bundles of clothing to sell in the city of Huancayo. The clothing is purchased in Lima and is attractive and modern, reason for which it sells quickly. 

She enjoys helping her customers choose their clothing most about her work. That is how she earns their affection. She has been doing this for 3 years and feels that the hardest part is transporting the bundles from city to city since it is quite tiring. 

In the future she hopes to open a store in the city of San Francisco where she could serve her customers better. This is her second loan with MFP and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is a well liked member of her community bank since she is very supportive. With the two thousand Nuevos Soles she has requested she will buy more clothing in Lima which will increase her inventory and sales.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in Lima to increase her inventory

loans.name: Arlene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Arlene; ella tiene 28 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de artesanía ella vende CDS y DVS  de la historia de Cusco,Valle Sagrado,Machupicchu entre otros ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria todas las mañanas y todas las tardes por las calles de Cusco.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería  y así poder ofrecer á mas clientes y dar a conocer un poco mas de nuestra historia mediante su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo
texts.en:
[Arlene] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Arlene is 28 years old.  She is in a cohabitating relationship, has two children, and sells CDs and DVDs that tell the history of Cusco,Valle Sagrado,Machupicchu, and other places.  She sells on foot, in the streets of Cusco, every morning and evening.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more merchandise so that she can sell to more customers and let more people learn our history through this business.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
"M. M. is a married woman who lives in Prk Kangkasa, Brg. Jolomaynon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a vegetable vending business. Her husband Alberto Bombarda, who is 29 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 2 months and 2 years old respectively.

M. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, M. has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,950, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use as funds for her business operations so she can continue to save up for her children's future. M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: Alba madre soltera, tiene a sus hijos estudiando, los planes es que sus hijos se preparen para que tenga mayor opción de trabajo. Tiene su propio negocio de ventas de cosméticos desde hace 8 años, lo inicio con fondo propios ahorros que poseía en esos tiempo lo cual solo vendía pequeñas cantidades y encargos que le realizaban.  Por medio de los prestamos que ha realizado con nosotros a ingresado otras productos y mantener en existencia para ofrecer a sus cliente en el momento que lo busca. Dentro de sus proyectos es agrandar más su negocio en corto plazo. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de: sombras para ojo, lápiz labial, lápiz de ceja, tintes para el cabello, pintura labial, delineadores, marbellí, pulsera de fantasía y de oro, chapas, anillos de fantasía y de oro, aretes de oro, entre otros productos para mayor variedad. Obteniendo mayores ingresos y ofreciéndole a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Alba is a single mother.  Her children are in school and the idea is for them to study what will give them the best chance of finding work. She has had her own cosmetics sales business for the last 8 years that she began with the savings from those days.  She didn't sell very much in general, just some orders that she had.  With the loans that she has received from us she has included other products and has been able to keep inventory to sell to her customers when they are looking for items.  One of her projects is to enlarge her business soon.  The loan will be used to buy: eye shadows, lip liners, eyebrow pencils, hair coloring, lipsticks, eyeliners, marbellí, costume and gold bracelets, earrings, costume and gold rings, gold hoops, etc, to have a greater variety.  Getting more income will allow her to offer her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Cosmetics sales

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, d’habillements, du bois de chauffe, des condiments  alimentaires et d’arachide. Ces femmes sont à leur sixième prêt. 
ASSAN C., la présidente du groupe Djiguiya compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habillements et du bois de chauffe.
Elle s’approvisionne en habillements généralement à Bamako et le bois de chauffe sur place. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women in the Djiguiya group are all married and are on average 45 years old with five children. They all live in traditional extended families in the Fana prefecture, part of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got acquainted through family ties and as neighbors, and are retail merchants of plastic kitchen utensils, clothing, firewood, culinary condiments and peanuts. This is their sixth loan request.

Assan C. - president of the Djiguiya group – wants to use her loan to buy clothing and firewood. She usually gets her clothing supplies in Bamako and the firewood locally. She sells her products at retail prices at the market in Fana, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers.

She hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 25,000 FCFA which she will devote in part to the family’s daily expenditures, the remainder being reinvested in her commercial activities.

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is 30 years old and supports her family by operating a business venture buying and selling eggs. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard buying and selling eggs, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 31,800. Charie is borrowing PHP 9,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Charie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Mirzoahmad

texts.ru: Алиев Мирзоахмад проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Мирзоахмад предоставляет услугу. Он занимается перевозками, развозит людей по маршруту Душанбе-Вахдат. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Mirzoahmad A. lives in the region of Vahdat. He is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Mirzoahmad provides services by transporting people by the Dushanbe-Vahdat route. He has been in this business for two years. He is taking out the loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle

loans.name: Maria Odilia

texts.es: La señora Maria Odilia T. Ramírez desde hace años quedo viuda por lo que tuvo que salir adelante para mantener los gastos de la familia. Odilia cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 3 años, donde ofrece variedad de estilos y tallas para el gusto de cada persona. En este momento desea un préstamo para surtir su negocio de ropa de temporada.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Odilia T. Ramírez has been a widow for several years, so she has had to move forward in order to cover the family finances. Odilia has been managing a business selling used clothes for three years. She offers a variety of styles and sizes that suits all tastes.

At the moment, she requests a loan so that she can restock her business with seasonal clothing.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Juan Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Juan; El socio es soltero,  y es conductor, el socio trabaja como chofer de buses, en la ruta de Cusco Urubamba, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y su papá le presta el vehículo para que el trabaje, el socio está ahorrando y poco a poco comprando sus artefactos e implementando su casa, en esta oportunidad el socio desea invertir en la compra de un refrigerador, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un refrigerador. 

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas“ Communal Bank located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The member’s name is Juan.  He is unmarried and works as a bus driver on the Cusco Urubamba route.  He is a very hard-working person and his father lends him the vehicle for work.  He is saving and gradually buying appliances and furnishing his home.  He is requesting the loan at this time to purchase a refrigerator.  

Juan is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making the payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase a refigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 47 years old and married with four children. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, curls, shampoo, candy and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Elsa would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. Muiruri is 48 years old, married to Esther Gathoni, and they have three children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 23 years. 

Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his fifth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 22 years old. Ronel is single. To make a living, Ronel owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood, bananas and malangas in the local community. Ronel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ronel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood and green bananas. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ronel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and green bananas

location.town: Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Victor Sabino

texts.es: El señor Víctor tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores e independientes, su esposa de dedica a las labores de su casa el señor víctor se dedica a la compra y venta de algodón viene laborando en esta actividad ya como 15 años, también tiene otro ingreso tiene un terreno lo cuál da en alquiler para cultivo, su sueño a futuro es tener su casa propia ya que antes vivía en casa de un familiar y con el terremoto del 2006 se destruyo, el dinero será invertido en comprar semillas de algodón para luego venderlo, víctor esta muy agradecido con la confianza que se le esta brindando
texts.en: Víctor is 63 years old, married and has three children who are adults and independent.  His wife is a housewife and Víctor is a cotton merchant.  He’s been in this line of work for about 15 years now.  He also has another source of income: a piece of land that he leases for farming.  His future dream is to own a house because he used to live in a relative’s house but it was destroyed in the 2006 earthquake.  The money will be used to buy cotton seeds to resell later.  Víctor is very grateful for the trust that’s being placed in him.

loans.use: to buy cotton seeds.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mr. Im is 52 years old, living in Baray district. He runs a horse-cart taxi, providing service for passengers or for picking goods up. He earns a profit of $3 a day to help meet his family's expenses. He is married with eight children – four of them are single and the rest are married and living away from home. Most of them are employed in different occupations. His wife is a rice farmer. 

Mr. Im often helps his wife with the business growing crops when he has time away from his horse-cart taxi. Mr. Im is looking for Kiva funds to use to pay for plowing costs and to purchase insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers for growing the crop well.

loans.use: to pay plowing costs and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.en:
Mathieu is 30 years old, and he has three children who are between the ages of 8 months and 7 years. He owns a general store in which he sells different kinds of items which include sugar, salt, matches and some foodstuffs such as maize flour. He has run this business for the past six years and it has enabled him meet the needs of his family and educate his children as well. 

He needs a loan to buy more items in order to make more profits. Mathieu plans to save the profits until he can begin constructing a house for himself.

loans.use: to buy items for his general store.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky is 37 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she has been doing this work for 10 years. Vicky is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase herbicides, fuel for irrigation and fertilizers such as manure. Vicky hopes that this loan will benefit her operations. Currently, in this line of work she earns about 30,000 PHP (~$720) each harvest. Vicky wants to get high yields on her farm to sustain the needs of her children in school so as to attain her biggest dream in life, which is to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and fuel for irrigation.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Sabino; el tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el hace servicio urbano público, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el hace servicio desde el cusco e izcuchaca,el socio por medio de este negocio de transporte saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y quiere de terminar de construir su casa ,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en la ruta de Izcuchaca-Cusco,el socio también. El  socio solicita el préstamo para compara materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, piedras y yeso para terminar de construir su casa. 
                                            
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabino, 37, belongs to the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank located in Anta District that belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

He has a spouse and three children.  He alternates his daily chores with providing transportation services.  He provides urban public transportation service.  He works from 7am until 10pm on the Cusco-Izcuchaca route.  Through the transportation business he’s able to support his children.  He wants to expand the transportation service and to finish building his house.  He also has a car providing taxi service along the Izcuchaca-Cusco route.  He is asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand, stone and plaster to finish building his house.

He is happy with the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek is a village man, 41, living in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city. He works with a local crane truck where he can earn about $5 per day and is married to Vannat, 39, with three children. Vannat sells items such as pork, fish, and vegetables, and typically makes $5 profit a day to meet her family’s daily expenses. Two of their children are married and live separately. The youngest child is going to operate a local hair and beauty salon in order to increase the family’s income. What this whole family dreams of in the next few years is living in a new house and operating a bigger hair and beauty salon. The majority of the loan is to invest in their daughter’s business.

loans.use: to operate a local hair and beauty salon.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Josephine has a business selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for nine years, and she works seven days out of every week.

Josephine sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. 

The main business challenges for Josephine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build rental rooms and also to sell wholesale only.   

Josephine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees  and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Elcira

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican al comercio, transporte público y turismo.

María se dedica a la venta de cerveza en un local propio, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace varios años, tiene más clientela lo fines de semana por diferentes eventos que hay, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer María a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza y otras bebidas, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco.
texts.en:
María is a 50-year-old mother who lives in her own home with her two children. They receive all of the basic services. María resides in the urban section of Chiclayo Province. All of the residents in this area engage in retail, public transportation, and tourism.

María has been selling beer from her own shop for several years. She has more customers on the weekend because there are different events taking place, which allows her to increase her earnings and improve the quality of life for her family.

María is taking the opportunity to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can buy large quantities of beer and other beverages. She hopes to generate more revenue and expand her customer base so that she can repay this loan and help her family move forward a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy beer and other beverages in large quantities.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a sales agent in a local company since 2004. His wife, who works in a communication center, helps him pay for the household expenses and especially the children’s education fees. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his daughter’s university education fees. She is studying translation and this is her last year. Hussein notes that his daughter is a very ambitious woman and willing to reach a higher education level.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s university education fees

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora María, ella tiene 57 años de edad,  es madre soltera de  dos hijos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aún viven con ella.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario desde hace mas de 15 años tiene un bar,   en el cual además de  vender gaseosas y cervezas, también vende bocadillos y  comidas rápidas, ella nos cuenta que trabaja desde las 14h00 ya que a esa hora y en las noches acuden sus clientes a su local a conversar y distraerse un poco después de las labores diarias. Trabaja todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, cervezas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y le gusta los beneficios que tiene al ser socia de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local mucho más grande y un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

Sra. María lives in this place. She is 57 years old and a single mother of two grown children. One of them still lives with her.

María has earned her daily living for more than 15 years by managing a bar where she sells sodas and beer. She also offers snacks and fast food. María says that she works from 2pm and continues through the night because that is when her customers come to her establishment to talk and find a bit of a distraction after a day of work. She works every day and her children help with managing the business.

This loan will be used to buy sodas, beer, and ingredients for preparing her dishes. María is participating in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits associated with being a member of the organization. Her dreams include having a larger establishment and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer, and ingredients.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has owned a shop selling and repairing motorcycles and spare parts since 2004. He has more than seven years experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old, married and has six children. She has a retail store selling fruits and vegetables, e.g., bananas, eggplant and onions, and eggs too. She established this business three years ago. 

Edna wants to enhance her business to earn additional income, so she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy bananas, eggplant and cabbages to sell. This will help increase her earnings. She would like to improve her sales to save for the education of her children. She wants them to achieve their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplant and cabbages to sell

loans.name: El Lucero De Las Flores Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Yanet tiene 29 años, convive con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella es la presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “El Lucero de las Flores”, eligieron el nombre porque las socias viven en la zona de las Flores y su entusiasmo por formar un grupo lo asocian a una luz de esperanza. 

La Sra. Yanet tiene una bodega en su casa donde vende abarrotes, gaseosas, cervezas y demás; con este negocio ya lleva 4 años. Ella vio el emprendimiento de su hermano y de su cuñado cuando abrieron sus propias bodegas años atrás, y al ver que era un negocio rentable decidió meterse en el mismo campo, descubriendo que era buena en este rubro. Ella empezó a trabajar motivada por el deseo de comprar su terreno a fin de tener su casa propia; al cabo de 3 años lo consiguió, no sin antes haberse esforzado mucho. Este ha sido su mayor logro hasta el momento, lo que sigue después es construirlo de material noble y darle comodidad y bienestar a su familia.

Debido al costo que ha requerido al comprar su terreno, aun no puede ahorrar, pero con el apoyo del grupo esto va a ser posible. Entre sus planes futuros esta el de abrir una pollería en su terreno. Por el momento ella se ocupa de los gastos de la casa y su esposo cubre los gastos del terreno.
texts.en:
Sra. Yanet is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two young children. She is the president of the Communal Bank “El Lucero de Las Flores”. This name was chosen by the members because they live in the District of Las Flores and their enthusiasm to form a group represents the light of hope.

Sra. Yanet has a store in her home where she sells groceries, sodas, beer, and other products. She has been in this business for four years. Yanet watched her brother and her brother-in-law open their own stores years ago and saw them develop profitable businesses, so she decided to go into the same line of work for herself. She started working because she wanted to buy land for building her own house. Yanet achieved her goal in three years and she would not have accomplished this if she had not worked so hard. This by far has been her greatest achievement to date. Now she wants to proceed with the construction by using solid materials in order to provide greater comfort for her family’s well-being.

Due to the expenses related to purchasing her land, she has not been able to save. With the support of her group, Yanet now sees that this is possible. Her future plans include opening a poultry business on her property. At the moment, she is concerned about the household expenses while her husband takes care of the costs of their property.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya, where she has been farming for 10 years with the help of one farmhand. She is 51 and married with 3 children who are all adults. The youngest is still enrolled in post-secondary education. Her farm currently produces milk, spinach, potatoes, and tea for the local community.

Jane has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this loan will help improve her farming income and enable her meet her family needs more easily. She is optimistic that her business will grow, and she plans to venture into the transport business, too.

She says that Juhudi Kilimo services are prompt, and she is glad to be in business with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. Samuel is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for eight years. He is mainly faced with challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, which has resulted in high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goal is to build a permanent home. Samuel needs a loan to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to build a permanent house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Leonza

texts.es: María, está solicitando otro préstamo ya que quiere comprar la materia prima para realizar sus productos como el cáñamo, Hilo de seda de varios colores, manguillos, para continuar en su elaboración de hamacas.Ella considera que de la mano de los préstamos ha logrado superar el nivel de producción y ha generado mayores ventas con clientes.
texts.en: María is requesting another loan as she wants to buy raw materials - such as canvas, silk thread in various colors, and cuffs - to continue making hammocks. She believes that thanks to these loans, she has managed to increase her level of production and has generated more sales with her customers.

loans.use: to buy canvas, silk thread in various colors, and cuffs.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a mother of six who lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a dairy farmer. She began the business after purchasing cows and dairy goats. Nyevu learnt of Kiva partner Milango from her friends.

Nyevu is applying for a loan of 36,000 Kenya shillings in order to construct a crush and purchase two more cross breed dairy cows. Her main challenge is seasonal weather and some clients not paying on time. Nyevu hopes to build a larger herd of cattle in the future. She will save some of the extra income and apply for an additional loan in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to construct a crush and purchase two more cross breed dairy cows.

loans.name: Lopezine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du nom de Lopezine est âgée de 24 ans. Lopezine est mariée et a un enfant. Elle a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter ses charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la gestion d'un bar-café depuis huit mois. Dans le but de faire face à une clientèle fidèle et variée de plus en plus croissante, Lopezine sollicite, ensemble avec sa coéquipière un premier crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group is made up of two people.  The group's representative, named Lopezine, is 24 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She has attended secondary school.  In order to cover her daily expenses, she has been managing a bar/coffee-shop for the past eight months.  In order to meet the needs of a faithful and diverse group of customers, which is increasing in size, Lopezine is requesting a first loan from Finadev, together with the other member of her group.  Lopezine is the woman shown in the left portion of the photo.

loans.use: to buy six crates of various drinks, one box of milk, 10kg of sugar and one box of spaghetti
